loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ellas son mayores de edad y trabajan, inicio a vender pupusas por las tardes hace más de 10 años, con el propósito de tener una fuente de ingresos para costear los gastos familiares, no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Solicita un crédito para comprar leña, gas propano, maíz, harina, aceite aderezo, entre otros materiales que utiliza para elaborar la venta de pupusas, espera que las demandas sean mayores y que al tener la materia prima necesaria las pueda cubrir.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio mucho más reconocido en la zona e ir cubriendo el pago de las cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
María lives in her own house with her two daughters, who are adults and are working. She started selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas] in the afternoons more than 10 years ago, with the goal of having a source of income to cover family expenses. She doesn't have problems with her business.

She is applying for a loan to buy firewood, propane gas, corn, flour, oil, dressing, and other things that she uses to make pupusas for sale. She hopes that demand increases, and that having the necessary ingredients will allow her to meet it.

Her aspirations are to have a business that is much more renowned in the area, and to make her payments for the loan she acquires.

loans.use: to buy firewood, propane gas, corn, flour, oil, dressing, and other things that she uses to make pupusas [stuffed tortillas] for selling.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 37 years old and married, with three children.

Noeme works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, noodles, and shampoo.

Noeme has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from abaca weaving.

Noeme aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, noodles, and shampoo.

loans.name: Jamaica

texts.en:
Jamaica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket-weaving business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her basket-weaving business.

Jamaica has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Jamaica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from vegetable vending. Judith is borrowing PHP 13,500 through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has five children who are still in school.

Lolita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Ahmad. Ahmad lives in North Bogor, a suburban area located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Ahmad owns a stall that sells rice and mobile airtime credits for his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business using technology.  Ahmad is a friendly and informative mobile provider, that’s why he has many customers. 

As the business grows, Ahmad needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Ahmad’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Ahmad is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Naseemul

texts.en: Naseemul is 45 years old; she is a married woman.  She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested for a loan of client loan PKR 55,000 to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Rinita

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Rinita. Rinita lives in North Bogor, a suburban area located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two children (one daughter and one son). Rinita owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their children’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. 

As the business grows, Rinita needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Rinita’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Rinita is the one who is sitting. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Agus. Agus lives in Depok, a suburban area located about one hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his two children.

Agus works as an employee in a private company in Depok. He joined Ruma last year, having decided to join Ruma because he wanted to learn about how to start up a business using technology. Agus is a hardworking man, and his community sees him as a friendly and trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Agus needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, so that his community members can connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart.

Agus’ goal for his Ruma service in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for his community; this is Ruma’s latest product, which is called Mapan.

Agus appears in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm supplies for maintaining his coffee crops.

loans.name: Haysam

texts.en:
Haysam is a 39 year old Palestinian building painter, living in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon with his wife and 15 year old daughter. While his wife is unemployed and their daughter still goes to school, Haysam has been working as a building painter for more than 10 years. His income is the family's only source of revenue and covers all the household's expenses. 
Haysam is asking for a 2,893,627 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva field partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan to increase his cash liquidity which allows him to buy new painting supplies, take more projects and increase his income. Haysam's goal is to become financially sustainable and see his business grow to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy painting supplies

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: Divorcée et âgée de 50 ans, Félicité est une femme très entreprenante et active dans la gestion de ses besoins. Félicité habite à Adidogomé pour préparer des beignets faits à base des bananes. Félicité trouve le bénéfice nécessaire et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs au marché. Pour acheter des paniers de bananes, Félicité demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande et réaliser assez de profit pour répondre favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Divorced and aged 50, Félicité is an enterprising and active woman working at covering her needs. She lives in Adidogomé and prepares fritters made with bananas. She earns the needed profit and stocks up twice a month from suppliers in the market. 

To buy some baskets of bananas, Félicité is requesting this loan to pay for her order and make enough profit to cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 baskets of bananas

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr: A 53 ans, Aku est une femme mariée et avec ses sept enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Aku vend du charbon du bois dans son quartier pour gagner son revenu. Aku s’approvisionne une fois par mois dans un marché local. Aku réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce et nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et aider ses enfants à avoir une bonne vie éducative.
texts.en: Aku is a 53 year old married woman with seven children, living in the Adidogomé area. Aku sells charcoal in her neighborhood to make a revenue. Aku resupplies once per month in a local market. Aku is achieving a very good rate of return in her business. She requires this loan to buy bags of charcoal in order to attain higher profits and to help her children's educational growth.

loans.use: to buy 18 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and three-year old son. In 2013, her husband was diagnosed with multi-drug resistant TB. He became very depressed and had to stop working. The borrower, who had a small baby, began taking odd jobs, washing clothes or cleaning houses, in order to help her husband. 

Fortunately, her husband has been able to recover and is now working again, but the borrower would like to continue working so that the family can have two incomes and they can cover medical expenses for their child. Last year he was accidentally hit in the head and his parents monitor him closely, taking him to medical appointments when necessary. She is also concerned that her husband may relapse if he works too many hours.  

Through Partners in Health – Peru, the borrower will receive a small loan to set up a stand to sell orange juice and sharpen kitchen utensils near her home. In the future, she would like to set up a hardware store, a profitable option around her neighborhood.

loans.use: To pay for equipment for utensil sharpening and orange juice production

loans.name: Tului

texts.en:
Tului is a 55-year-old woman who is married, with five children. To earn an income, she has a small taxi business. She has two years' experience with this business. 

Tului needs a loan to buy new tires, a new gear box, and a full paint job. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Tului joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a new gear box, and a full paint job.

loans.name: Ianeta

texts.en:
Ianeta is a 24-year-old mother with one child. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Ianeta has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, fry pan, and container to assist her in running the business.

She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. Ianeta joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, fry pan, and container.

loans.name: Mealofa

texts.en:
Mealofa is a 33-year-old mother with two children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. 

Mealofa has requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than four years. 

Mealofa became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en:
Salafai is 25 years old with one child. She runs a small business cooking rice and chicken curry and selling the food at a school compound to earn a living.

Salafai is a Samoan citizen, she is very happy in operating her business because she gains a lot from it. She hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this, Salafai needs to borrow money to buy rice, chicken, flour, containers, aluminum foil, and curry. 

Salafai joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, flour, containers, aluminum foil, and curry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosaura, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de carnes, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio e l cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes entre otros.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, plastiqueria, ferretería, docente, venta de ropa, transporté.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Virgen del Carmen"; this bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.
The featured member is Rosaura. She still has her meat-selling business and is grateful to those who are part of this dream through Kiva. She is committed to making her payments by the deadline. She continues to selling meat in one of the city markets in Cusco. She is a responsible and dedicated person, and in this way she is able to provide for her family.
Rosaura has been running this business for quite a long time now, and it is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy meat and other products.
The other partners make their livings in teaching, transportation, and selling food, plastic items, hardware, and clothes.

loans.use: to buy meat and other products.

loans.name: Yanett Dionisia

texts.es:
La socia Yanett Dionisia pertenece al banco comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO.
La socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de plata, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  continua vendiendo pulseras, aretes entre otros, la socia a la vez también ejerce su carrera de enferma, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de collares entre otros.
texts.en:
Yanett Dionisia is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano. 

She continues to work in her business selling silver. She is a responsible and hardworking person. She continues to sell bracelets, earrings, and other items, while studying nursing at the same time. She wants to be able to keep working so she can continue to support her family. She is requesting this loan to buy necklaces and other items.

loans.use: to buy necklaces and other items

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 56 years old, married and a resident of Aloran, in the Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have five children, of whom two are in school.  

Starting with a capitalization of 3,000 PHP, Daisy opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. 

Aside from the financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2011 and has taken out three loans. 

Now Daisy is applying for 49,900 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.He wants to restock milk, sugar, canned goods and noodles.  

In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and she will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies and land good jobs.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari (variety) store, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Albertano

texts.en:
Albertano, 54, is married and lives in Canlambo, Siquijor, Philippines. He has one adult child. For the past six years he has worked in sales.

Because Albertano became a new member of PMPC he wanted to be able to earn more through his business. He has decided to start raising hogs and is applying for a 5,700 PHP loan from PMPC to buy bags of feed and animal vitamins. He will be very happy someday if he can see his family living comfortably and bountifully.

loans.use: to buy bags of pig feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. Ninfa has a general store business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming rice and pig fattening. 

Ninfa is requesting her twenty eighth loan from NWTF for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell at her general store. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Michell

texts.en:
Michell is 30 years old, married and has one child.

Michell is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. She has been farming vegetables for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Michell would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 51 years old and married with four children.

Annabel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries.

Annabel has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Annabel aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Amelia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Amelia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Amelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Sofia has a fishing business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Sofia has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: May Ann

texts.en:
May Ann is 34 years old and married with two children who are both in school.

May Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, diapers, soap and other groceries.

May Ann has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

May Ann aspires to save enough money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, diapers, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 50 years old and has two children. She is a married woman.

Flora is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Flora has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Flora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
james is 17 years old and is the ninth of ten children in the family. His mother Martina supports the family through her dress making business in the Philippines.

james is studying for the Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Martina is borrowing PHP 8,000 to pay for tuition fees of the first year, second semester of the year 2015-16.

When he graduates, James plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Wenna Rose

texts.en:
Wenna Rose is 21 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Wenna Rose has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Wenna Rose has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Tati. Tati lives in South Bogor, a suburban area located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two children (one boy and one girl). Tati works as a teacher. 

As a woman, she realized that she has to help her husband increase their income. That's why she decided to join Ruma last year. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn how to start up a business using technology. Tati is a hardworking woman and her community sees her as a cheerful and kind mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Tati needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community, so her community can connect with their loved ones no matter how far they are apart. 

Tati’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Tati is the one who is sitting. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes en zona rural del municipio de Támesis.
Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector que siempre prefieren visitar su tienda para adquirir sus productos.

Todos los días trabaja para tener una buena vida y un excelente futuro.

Trabaja solo durante 9 horas todos los días.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su negocio.

El guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Luis is a very nice person who always has a smile for the customers who come into his grocery store in a rural area of Támesis. Thanks to his charisma and good disposition, he has been able to win the hearts and recognition of the people in his neighborhood, who always prefer coming to his store to buy their products.

He works daily in order to have a good life and an excellent future. He works by himself, nine hours a day.

He is currently requesting a loan to stock up on grocery products like grains, sweets, drinks, and other items. This will allow him to significantly boost his business.

He is hopeful that he will be able to stay in business and continue making an impact on his customers' lives by providing great customer service.

loans.use: to buy grocery products like grains, sweets, drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Hendra

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Hendra. He lives in West Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour and a half drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and only daughter. 

Hendra works as a private employee. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about expanding his business through the use of technology. Together with his wife, they realized that they need to save more money for their daughter’s education. 

Hendra is a friendly and informative mobile provider; that’s why he has many customers. As the business grows, he needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so they can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are.

In the near future, Hendra’s goal with Ruma is to provide an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product, Mapan. Hendra is seen in the photo above. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members for mobile phone use.

loans.name: Bahreni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Bahreni. Bahreni lives in Cilegon, a suburban area located about two hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Bahreni owns a stall that sells daily consumer products. He joined Ruma last year and he decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to start up a business using technology. Bahreni is a really hardworking man and his community sees him as a friendly and informative mobile service provider.

Bahreni has become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product designed for lower income communities called Mapan. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change with agents like Bahreni. As their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children.  

As a Mapan agent, Bahreni is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Bahreni will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Bahreni believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. 

As the business grows, Bahreni hopes to get working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to help community members save up for big purchases through Mapan. As seen in the photo, Bahreni is the one who is standing and holding Mapan’s poster. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to increase the working capital deposit needed to help community members save up for big purchases through Ruma's layaway product called Mapan.

loans.name: Maharoumba

texts.fr: Maharoumba vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 54 ans. Mariée, Maharoumba est mère de quatre enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Maharoumba vend des oignons dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Maharoumba s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs d’oignons, Maharoumba demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité afin de promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Maharoumba is 54 years old and lives in Adidogomé. Maharoumba is married and the mother of four children. She works enthusiastically to foster their education. Maharoumba sells onions in her neighborhood and nearby to earn enough revenue to make ends meet. Maharoumba resupplies twice per month at the market. Maharoumba is requesting this loan to buy sacks of onions and increase her rate of return in order to promote her children's education.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of onions.

loans.name: Roselita

texts.en:
Roselita is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Roselita has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Roselita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a 21-year old vocational graduate and lives in Bago City. Her father died 5 years ago and her mother is a house maid in Iloilo City. Andrea is the youngest in their family, and she has 2 siblings. Her eldest sister is already married and her other sister has just recovered from a bus accident.

Their total monthly family income of 7,500 PHP ($169) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Andrea to find the means to help the family have more income, so that's why she braved the selection process of BagoSphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job.

Andrea aims to finish her training and help her family to provide their basic needs. Andrea would like to learn and to have confidence to communicate with other people. Andrea's biggest dream is to become a professional, to have a stable job, and to help her family. Your generosity in funding her loan would greatly motivate Andrea to improve her quality of life and have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Simeamativa

texts.en:
Simeamativa is a 39-year-old mother with eight children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living.

Simeamativa has requested a loan to buy a freezer, twist ties, chicken, a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business.

She has been doing this for more than four years. Simeamativa became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, twist ties, chicken, a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar water-heating system

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 49-year-old mother with four children. She is a Samoan citizen and operates a business of selling elei printing at the market to earn a living.

Maria hopes to expand her business by exporting overseas, but in order to do this, Maria needs a loan amount of 1,000 WST to buy paint color, paint brushes, rolling material, a printing machine, and container to help run the business.

She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy paint color, paint brushes, rolling material, a printing machine, and container.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 60-year-old widow with 9 children. She makes and sells pancakes to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Elena needs a loan to buy bags of flour, large pots, a new oven, a strainer, cooking oil, and a bag of sugar. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and support her children's education. Elena has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, large pots, a new oven, a strainer, cooking oil, and a bag of sugar.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
A loan amount of 1,000 WST will help Lupe to buy a cooler, straws, plastic bags, canned soda, twist ties, tuna fish (canned), bread, butter, and mayonnaise to help her run her business. 

Lupe is a young mother with two children. She is 24 years old. She joined SPBD in 2015, and she will use her profit to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, straws, plastic bags, canned soda, twist ties, tuna fish (canned), bread, butter, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en:
Ioana is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells Samoan fried chips in her community to earn a living. She has nine years of experience with this business. 

Ioana needs a loan to buy a large frying pan, a barrel of cooking oil, seasoning salt, plastic bags and a strainer. She plans to use her profits to help support her family in any way possible. Ioana has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy a large frying pan, a barrel of cooking oil, seasoning salt, plastic bags and a strainer

loans.name: Sieni

texts.en:
Sieni is a 34-year-old mother with two children. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Sieni needs a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise to assist with the business.

She will expand her business using her profit. Sieni joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Mofada

texts.en:
Mofada is a 19-year-old single man from a village near Hebron city. He lives with his family in a small simple house and the family has a bakery where they make different types of bread and sweets. Mofada would like to improve the family business so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a dough mixer for the bakery. This will increase their productivity and also their income. 

Mofada appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a dough mixer for the bakery.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Josefina  pertenece al banco comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua elaborando desayunos, almuerzo y cena, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, carnes, aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the MARIA ELENA MOYANO communal bank.

She continues to manage her restaurant business. Josefina has been running this restaurant for quite a while now, and the business is going well thanks to all the hard work she puts into it every day.

She continues to prepare breakfasts, lunches, and dinners, and she wants to be able to keep on working so that she can keep on supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, meats, and oil, among other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, meats, and oil, among other products.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old married man from the city of Khan Younis. He lives with his wife in a small house. He has sold clothing for eight years and would like to start his own business. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN to buy women's clothing for his new store. This will help him to improve his family's living conditions and income.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for his new store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dried fish and smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad.  To Ruth PMPC came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has accessed another loan for the next crop season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. She perseveres and always believes to reach her goals and continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has eight school-aged and adult children. Melba owns and operates a vegetable garden business. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Melba joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melba is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer for her garden.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.fr:
Miriam is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Miriam is 34 years old and has one child in school.

Miriam has a sea shells vending business in the Philippines. Miriam requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sea shells to sell in her food stall.

Miriam has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Miriam would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 34 years old and has one child in school.

Miriam has a sea shells-vending business in the Philippines. Miriam requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more sea shells to sell in her food stall.

Miriam has been in this business for five years. In the future, Miriam would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sea shells to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 63 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 42 years and also earns an income from selling personal products and raising chickens.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marc B Group

texts.fr: Faustine est une commerçante, membre du  collectif de crédits «Marc B», âgée de 47 ans, veuve, mère de 6 enfants  dont 5 scolarisés et 1 est marié. Elle est vendeuse divers habillement dans un magasin de la  ville depuis 26 ans. Elle commença ses business par de fonds reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des jupes, vestes, pantalons, chemises, sous vêtements, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Faustine is a merchant and member of the credit group Marc B. She is a 47-year-old widow with six children, one of them married and the other five in school.

Faustine has been selling various clothing items at a store in the city for 26 years. She started this business with funding from her late husband. She is seeking this loan from Hekima to bolster her activity. She plans to buy skirts, vests, pants, shirts, underwear, etc. Her goals are to feed her children and to support their education. 

Faustine wishes to thank Hekima for supporting businesswomen who cannot use traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy skirts, vests, pants, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more produce like maize to sell.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, a farmer living in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, is 42 years old and a mother of five children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She struggles to make a living by growing rice while her husband works as a construction worker to earn extra income. Together, they have been in this business for 22 years.

This is Phan’s first time with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is applying for a 3,500,000 KHR loan to buy construction tools for her business. She hopes that she can earn more money so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy construction tools for her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Busaira

texts.ru: Бусайра, 58 лет, вдова, есть ребенок. Образование-высшее, она на пенсии. С 1990 года Бусайра занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть корова, 50 коз, 24 козленка. Ежемесячная прибыль Бусайры составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. Она решила развить свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность, так как это единственный источник доходов и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Бусайра является лидером группы "Келиндер", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от бизнеса она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства, чтобы улучшить положение ее семьи.
texts.en:
Busaira is 58 years old, a widow, and has a child. She has a college degree and is now retired. Since 1990 Busaira has been raising livestock. She has one cow, 50 goats, and 24 goat kids on her farm. Her monthly revenue is 10,000 KGS, which is insufficient for a dignified life. 

Busaira has decided to develop her farm business as this is her sole source of income and applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 90,000 KGS to buy livestock. Busaira is the leader of the Kelinder borrowers’ group, which includes two other members besides her, for the total of three. Busaira plans to invest her revenues in a further development of her farm in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her headcount and her income

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un joven tranquilo y dedicado a su trabajo, tiene 24 años de edad, Juan vive en el campo y su familia vive con bajos recursos economicos y por este motivo no siguio sus estudios, Juan se dedica  hace 3 años atrás a la crianza de chanchos y tambien a trabajar al jornal, Juan necesita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en chancheras que tiene construido su madre, lo que Juan aspira es seguir trabajando y seguir siendo un joven de bien.
texts.en: Juan is a quiet young man dedicated to his work. He is 24 years old, lives in the countryside and his family has low economic resources, for this reason he did not continue in school.  For 3 years now, Juan has been raising pigs and working as a day laborer. Juan needs the money from the loan to invest in the purchase of pigs to keep them in the pens that his mother has built. He hopes to continue to work and to be a good young man.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Fatima Belen

texts.es: Fatima es madre soltera que tiene 30 años, Fatima tiene un hijo de 13 años y ya asiste el colegio, Fatima vive en la casa de su tio y alli hace funcionar su negocio que es un restaurante, Fatima tiene su negocio desde hace 2 años atrás, Fatima necesita el dinero del credito para comprar carne, arroz, papas y demas productos para preparar, Fatima tiene la aspiracion de mejorar su negocio y comenta que todo su esfuerzo es para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en: Fatima is a single mother, 30 years old. Fatima has a 13 year old son who is in secondary school. Fatima lives in her uncle's house and runs her business. a restaurant, there. Fatima has had this business for two years. Fatima needs the loan money to buy meat, rice, potatoes and other products to cook. Fatima aspires to improve her business and says that all her effort is for the wellbeing of her son.

loans.use: to buy products to prepare food

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed had completely repaid the first loan he received from Kiva lenders. That loan greatly helped him to increase his business and to improve his family's living conditions. He thanks Kiva lenders warmly for their previous loan. Ahmed applied for a second loan of 200,000 YER. It will be used to buy canned food and soft drinks to expand his grocery store. With this loan, his profits will improve his family's living conditions.Ahmed's father pays the monthly housing rent even though his income does not allow for this.  The profits from this loan will help Ahmed's father pay the rent. He hopes this loan will also be funded to help realize his ambition.

loans.use: to buy canned food and soft drinks.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.fr: Suzette est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Pour prendre soin de la famille, elle vend des produits alimentaires vivres, riz, sucre, maïs etc. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de riz importés.
texts.en:
Suzette, age 45, is married with five children. 

To help support her family, she sells food staples such as rice, sugar, corn, etc. 

She is seeking this loan to bolster her stock of imported rice.

loans.use: to buy sacks of imported rice for resale.

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.es:
Daniel es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua, dedicado a la producción de café desde hace más de 20 años. Es conocido en su comunidad como un hombre honesto y comprometido con su trabajo.

A pesar de que hace dos ciclos, su cafetal fue afectado gravemente por la roya, la cual es una plaga causada por el hongo Hemileia vastatrix que infecta las hojas del cafeto, esto no lo desanimó, sino que se dedicó a enfrentar esta situación con un manejo integrado de su finca.

En su última cosecha logró estabilizar su producción de café, y para este ciclo se ha propuesto continuar mejorando su cafetal, el cual es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. Para esto, Daniel está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos agrícolas que le permitan  mantener y mejorar la nutrición de su cafetal. Él está seguro que con un mantenimiento adecuado, logrará tener una mejor cosecha y mayores ingresos para su familia. Te animamos a apoyar a esta familia, y contribuir a fortalecer las condiciones económicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel is a farmer in northern Nicaragua. He has been dedicated to the production of coffee for more than twenty years. He is known in his community as an honest man committed to his work.

Although his coffee was seriously affected by rust two cycles ago, which is a disease caused by the fungus Hemileia vastatrix that infects coffee leaves, this did not deter him, rather he dedicated himself to face the situation with integrated management of his farm.

In his last harvest he stabilized his coffee production and with this cycle he plans to continue improving his coffee farm, which is the main source of income for his family. In order to do so, Daniel is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies to permit him to maintain and improve the nutrition of his coffee trees. He is sure that with proper maintenance he will achieve a better harvest and increased income for his family.

“We encourage you to support this family and help strengthen the family financial situation.”

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies that will ensure the proper care for his coffee trees.

loans.name: Opetela

texts.en:
Opetela is a 53-year-old mother with four children. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Opetela has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise to assist with the business.

She will expand her business using her profit. Opetela became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is 27 years old with one child. She runs a business of selling taro and bananas at the market to earn a living. She gains a lot from her business and is hoping to expand in the near future.

To do this, she needs to borrow an amount of 1,000 WST to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer to help run the business.

Christian joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Leutu

texts.en:
Leutu is a 34-year-old mother with two children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Leutu needs a loan of 1,000 WST to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to assist her to run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year.

 Leutu  hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en: Sreyneang is a 19-year-old single accounting student who lives with her parents and an older brother in the Svay Reang province in Cambodia. She is pursuing an associate’s degree in her first year at a university in the province. Her father is a construction worker and her mother is a grocer. Sreyneang is short of the finances to cover her university fees from the first to the second year; therefore she has decided to take out a loan. This loan will help her have enough finances to earn an associate’s degree, thereby earning her favorite skills for the future job. Sreyneang’s dreams are to have a proper job and to save money to pursue a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to cover her university fees from the first to the second year

loans.name: Alofi

texts.en:
Alofi is a Samoan citizen. She is 49 years and married with four children. Alofi runs a business selling handicrafts at the market to earn a living and provide for family needs. She hopes to expand her business by exporting the handicrafts to overseas. 

In order to do this, Alofi needs to borrow money to buy coconuts, sandpaper, cardboard, Super Glue, paint, and paint brushes to help her run the business. Alofi joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, sandpaper, cardboard, Super Glue, paint, and paint brushes

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en:
Asenati is 21 years old with one child. She operates a business of selling traditional elei prints at the market to earn a living. She has this experience for more than a year. 

Asenati joined SPBD in 2015. She needs a loan to buy paint color, rolling material, paint brush, and a container to assist the business. She will use her profit to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy paint color, rolling material, paint brush, and a container

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en:
Fialelei is 46 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for six years and has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

Fialelei needs a loan to buy gloves, boots, overalls, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a machete and a crowbar. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy gloves, boots, overalls, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a machete and a crowbar

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is 23 years old with one child. She runs a business of selling fresh flowers at the market for any special occasion. She has had this experience for more than a year.

Olga hopes to expand her business, but to do this she needs a loan amount of 1,000 WST to buy flower seeds (assorted), soil, hand gloves, and sponge to help run the business.

Olga became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds (assorted), soil, hand gloves, and sponge.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new seat cover, wheels,  window, license and air condition unit.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 70-year-old widow with 7 children. 

She has grown taro to sell in her community or at the market for 9 years. Maria needs a loan to buy chemicals, peanut seeds, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. 

Maria will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, peanut seeds, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade.

loans.name: Talaave

texts.en:
Talaave is a 36-year-old married woman with 3 children. She runs a small crafts business in her community. She has been doing this for 7 years. 

Talaave needs a loan to buy pandunus leaves, varnish, brushes, wood paint, wood glue, and a carving kit. In the future, Talaave hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy pandunus leaves, varnish, brushes, wood paint, wood glue, and a carving kit

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 44-year-old woman with 7 children.   She has owned and operated a business to sell pancakes, pork cakes, and buns for a year. 

Sina has  requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and frying pan. She hopes to use her profit to build a bakery  in the near future.

Sina  joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a frying pan.

loans.name: Soo

texts.en:
Soo is a 20-year-old single woman who runs a business selling elei printing at the market. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

She hopes to expand her business to gain more profit, and needs  $1000 WST to buy paint, a paint brush, rolling material, and a container. 

She will use her profit for her family's needs and assist the business.

She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy paint, a paint brush, rolling material, and a container.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Avei

texts.en:
Avei is 26 years old and is a citizen of Samoa. She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to seek financing for her business. She runs a business where she sews clothes and sells them at the market to earn a living.

Avei hopes to expand her business to gain more profit, but in order to do this, she needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, needles, a tape measure, and rolling materials for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, a tape measure, and rolling materials

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena is a 57-year-old mother of 3 children. To earn a living, she has a small business selling vegetables such as cabbage, eggplant, and cucumber in her community. She has been doing this for more than a year now. 

Matalena has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots to assist her in running her business. 

Matalena hopes to expand her business in the near future by using her business profits. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор 40 лет. Она жительница города Куляб. Гулрухсор замужем и мать четверых детей. У нее двое дочери и две сыновей. Дочкам 15 и 10 лет. Сыновьям 19 и 6 лет. Гулрухсор бизнес – леди. Она 8 лет продвигает торгову деятельность. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью, потому что ее мама работа именно в этой сфере деятельности.  И мама научила ее правильно общаться с клиентами и вести данный бизнес. Гулрухсор занимается продажей детских одежд. Она решила расширить деятельность и увеличить товар. Гулрухсор надеется с увеличением товара, увеличиться доход и может позволить своим детям новые экономические возможности.
texts.en: Gulruhsor is 40 and lives in the city of Kulob. She is married and has four children: two daughters, ages 10 and 15, and two sons, ages 6 and 19. Gulruhsor is a businesswoman and has had a retail business for eight years. She decided on this kind of business because her mother also works in this field. Her mother taught her how to communicate with customers and how to run a business. Gulruhsor sells children's clothing. She decided to expand her business and increase her inventory. Gulruhsor hopes that increasing her inventory will increase her profits and help give her children new economic opportunities.

loans.use: to obtain children's clothing in order to expand her inventory

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Deysi is 21 years old and she is a dedicated artisan she lives with her parents she loves them very much an she is always helping at her house Deysi and her family are not living comfortably they have to borrow electricity from the neighboor and the house doesn t have sewerage Deysi needs a loan to buy fabrics and clothes to make her crafts she hopes you can help her Deysi would like to move with her family in the future
texts.en:
Deysi is 21 years old and a dedicated artisan.  She lives with her parents and loves them very much. She always helps at her house.

Deysi and her family are not living comfortably, they borrow electricity from the neighboor and the house doesn t have sewerage. 

Deysi needs a loan to buy fabric and clothes to make craft items. She hopes you can help. Deysi would like to move with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and clothes to make craft items.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy, 47, lives in a community in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for 26 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 4.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, farming food and has been involved in this business for 3 years.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Lan faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Năm

texts.en:
Năm operates a food stall selling beverages. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Năm is 43 years old and she is married with three children. Năm lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Năm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Năm faces in her life is not having money to repair the latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.

In the future, Năm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 20-year-old single man from the city of Dier Al-Balah. He lives with his family in a small house. For the last year, he has been working by selling clothing and shoes. It is a good business, and the demand is high.

Nader took a USD Murabaha-type loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy women's clothing and shoes to resell from his stall. This will help him to improve both his income and his family's living conditions. 

Nader appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and shoes to resell from his stall.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva, 32, is a married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than 15 years now. She sells home cooked foods to the people in her place. Eva is asking to take a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, baking soda, sugar, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, and other items. A loan will allow her to cook more and sell more to her customers. In the future, Eva hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, baking soda, sugar, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, and other items

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. She owns operates a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Eva also owns a jeepney or vehicle used to transport passengers. Eva is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and to pay for the repair of the vehicle. Eva believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and to pay for the repair of the vehicle

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en: Ma. Nancy is from Tangub, in the Philippines. She and her husband have agricultural land and earn a living through farming. She makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for making holes and planting dwarf coconuts and banana seedlings on her land. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply agricultural produce in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for making holes and planting dwarf coconuts and banana seedlings on her land

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 32 years old. He is married with one child. 

Lawrence has had a retail shop business for 20 years and it has been profitable. 

He has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will be using to purchase additional stock of rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil and hopes this will help him buy more retail goods and meet the high demands of his customers. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his retail shop and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jig

texts.en:
Jig owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been doing this for the past 12 years and is able to provide for his family's needs. He successfully repaid his previous loan through his business.

To further improve the services he provides, he is taking out a new loan to buy motorparts for motor repair. He plans to use the additional revenue this will generate to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy motorparts for motor repair.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married, 51 years of age, and lives in Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, together with her child. Eva operates a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than nine years and she earns about 5,000 PHP every month. 

Eva is requesting a loan again of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.  Eva hopes that her business will progress and make her family living conditions better.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Bagong Silang Caloocan City, Philippines. She is 47 years old and  is married to Maximo, who is her business partner, and they help each other to provide for their family's needs. Lucy manages a buy-and-sell business of ready-to-wear items, and her income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenses.

What Lucy basically does is buy general merchandise items from wholesalers and then sells them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from ready-to-wear clothing and eye-wear to footwear and other similar products. Customers are attracted to the low selling prices and the many options that are offered. Lucy's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 PHP in sales every day.

Lucy is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more ready-to-wear items and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to increase her sales and her additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

In the future, Lucy hopes to have her own stall for her business. She also desires that her children will be able to complete their studies and that she can continue to improve her family's general living conditions. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear items and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel works hard to support her family. Ethel is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. With her are her friends in the market, they are also a fish vendors.

Ethel requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Ethel has been in this business for 10 years now.

Ethel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalina is 42 years old and five of her children are in school.

Rosalina has a food vending business in the Philippines and has requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like oil, sugar, etc..

Rosalina has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Syrin

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Syrin works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Syrin is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Syrin has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 51 years old and married with nine children. Three of her children are in school.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries.

Melinda has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for  15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Melinda aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is pedagogue with 28 years of work experience. She has corresponding higher education, and she works at the school as a deputy of director and also as a teacher of elementary classes. She is a very patient teacher, and she likes her work with children of the smaller age who are very clever, interesting and ready to learn to know more. At her house, she also gives private courses helping the pupils, those who have hardships, to prepare their lessons. 

Naira is married, and she has a daughter and son. 

Naira will be very happy if Kiva lenders support her with the loan amount in order to buy a computer, which she will use for her courses at home to make them more informative and didactic.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which she will use for her courses at home to make them more informative and didactic

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is 31 years old now.

Gemma has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, vive en casa propia junto  a su esposo, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y han formado su propio hogar, es propietaria de una tienda que fundo hace muchos años con ahorros y que poco a poco con las ganancias ha fortalecido.
Invertirá en lácteos, granos básicos, cereales, gaseosas, jugos y otros productos que sean necesarios para tener un mejor inventario, espera que sus clientes estén más satisfechos y que tanto sus ventas como ingresos sean mayores.
La aspiración de María es continuar trabajando para que junto a su esposo puedan tener un futuro con menos carencias.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own house with her husband. Her children are now adults and have formed their own households. She is the owner of a store that was founded many years ago with savings. Little by little, with her earnings, she has strengthened it.

She will invest in dairy products, basic grains, cereals, sodas, juices, and other products that are necessary for her to have a good inventory. She hopes that her clients are more satisfied and that her sales and her income are better.

Maria’s goal is to continue working so that she and her husband can have a future with little scarcity.

loans.use: to invest in dairy products, basic grains, cereals, sodas, juices, and other products that are necessary for her to have a good inventory.

loans.name: Luis Ovidio

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.

Es Padre de 1 hijo y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlo adelante.

El tiene una pequeña cafetería en la que vende frituras, comestibles, golosinas y refrescos. 

Trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

El desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de bebidas y frituras, además desea comprar insumos para su producción de alimentos de cafetería.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Luis is a man of experience, wisdom and a great deal of patience.

He is the father of a son, and has worked practically his whole life to help him succeed in life.

He has a small cafe where he sells fried food snacks, food, candy and soft drinks.

He works every day for 10 hours to have his products ready and fresh for his customers who are mostly people in the neighborhood where he lives.

He wishes to capitalize his business and take a big step forward in terms of ingredients and product inventory. That is why he is approaching INTERACTUAR for a loan to buy a supply of drinks and fried food snacks. In addition he wishes to buy supplies for making food in his cafe.

One of his main problems is lack of money to invest in his business, but he is relying on the help of Corporación Interactuar and the generosity of the Kiva lenders to keep his business moving forward.

loans.use: To buy a supply of drinks and fried food snacks. In addition he wishes to buy supplies for making food in his cafe.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una madre de 25 años de edad, emprendedora y dinámica. 

Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de restaurante, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que le colabora en las mañanas mientras ella cuida a sus hijos, así ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares y personales durante 1 año que lleva funcionando su negocio. 

El crédito que solicita estará destinado para la compra de ingredientes como carne, legumbres, granos, lácteos, entre otros para tener un inventario de insumos mucho más amplio y así poder tener esa estabilidad que tanto ha querido. 

Diana, con su espíritu de superación y su proyección hacia la consecución de sus objetivos, se traza la meta de ampliar su negocio, para tener la capacidad de atender a mayor cantidad de clientes, mejorando así la rentabilidad del establecimiento para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana is a mother and is 25 years old. She is entrepreneurial and dynamic.

With the desire to create an income to contribute to the family funds, she decided to start her own restaurant business. Her husband helps her and he works in he mornings while she looks after the children. In this way she has managed to pay for her family and personal expenses for the one year that she has been doing this. 

The loan that she is asking for is to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, grains, dairy products, among other things in order to have a wider inventory of supplies and thus be able to have the stability that she has wanted so much.

With her spirit for improvement and planning toward the attainment of her objectives she has designed the aim of expanding her business in order to reach more customers, thus improving the profitability of her establishment in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, grains, dairy products, among other things.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kratie province’s Kratie district, Touch is aged 42 years and married with two children. To make a living, Touch has been growing cassava and working for others for a fee. She can earn about KHR 58,000 per day. 

Touch has been a member of VisionFund for one loan cycle already, and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to make her living conditions better. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
