Ramaz is 50 years old. He is married and lives in Senaki district, Georgia with his wife, 3 children, and his 2 pensioner parents. 

Ramaz is unemployed at the moment and wants to start his own business. The Start Up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, will enable him to take a loan of 2,000 USD. 

With his received credit Ramaz will start a trading business. He will purchase a stock of clothing which he will resell. This will give him a chance to generate income and thus improve the living conditions for his family. 

Ramaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a trade in clothing.

loans.name: Borath's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kratie district of Kratie province, Borath is 37 years old and married. She has two children who are still in school. To better support the family, she and her husband have been selling grocery items. Having been in this business for 8 years, she can earn about 34,000KHR per day and manage to save about 12,000KHR each day after the expenses. 

Borath has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burden. Now she is leading her group to seek for another loan. As the leader, Borath wants to use her portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa, de 51 años de edad, no estudio, debido a la falta de recursos económicos, tuvo que comenzar a trabajar para cubrir las necesidades de la casa, ahora está soltera y tiene dos hijos.

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras.

Ella necesita el dinero para comprar tamarindo y verduras.

En el fututo Rosa, sueña ver a sus hijos preparados académicamente.
texts.en: Rosa, 51 years old, never studied due to the lack of economic resources.  She had to start working to cover the necessities of the home.  Now she is single and has two children.  Rose dedicates herself to the sale of fruits and vegetables.  She needs the loan to purchase tamarind and vegetables.  In the future, Rosa dreams of seeing her two children academically prepared.

loans.use: to purchase tamarind and vegetables.

loans.name: Set's Group

texts.en:
Set, 64, is a married mother living with her five children in a rural village of the Snoul district of Kratie province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice and cassava and she has been in this business for 15 years, earning about 45,000 KHR per day.

Set is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fee. With this loan, she hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Eha

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Eha. Eha lives in South Serang, a semi urban area located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her children (one daughter and one son). 

Eha owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their children's education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. She already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system from her friend, who already joined Ruma before her. 

As the business grows, Eha needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Eha’s goal toward Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Eha is the one who is in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Lelah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Lelah. Lelah lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her three children (one daughter and two sons). Lelah owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that she had to help her husband increase their income, which is why she decided to join Ruma last year. Lelah is a hardworking woman and her community sees her as a cheerful and kind mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Lelah needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community. Lelah’s goal in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. In the photo, Lelah is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her local community.

loans.name: Hendy

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Hendy. Hendy lives in East Bandung, located in West Java, about three hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two children. Hendy owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He knew about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall, and he decided to join Ruma last year because he wanted to expand his business through technology. 

Hendy is a friendly and cheerful man and his community sees him as a trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Hendy needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Hendy’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Hendy is the one who is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Tootoo

texts.en:
Tootoo is a 29-year-old mother with three children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year and became a member of SPBD in 2015.

Tootoo has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, a paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine for her business. She  hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, a paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Soo

texts.en:
Soo is 41-year-old mother with seven children. She runs a business selling handicrafts at the market. Soo hopes to expand her business. She needs a loan to buy paint, paint brushes, carvings, coconuts, Super Glue, and sandpaper to help her with the business. 

Soo is a Samoan citizen; she joined SPBD in 2015. She will use her profit for home improvement and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy paint, paint brushes, carvings, coconuts, Super Glue, and sandpaper

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new furniture for his cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of cosmetics and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Hafeth

texts.en:
Hafeth is a 26-year-old married man from Beddya, a village near Jenin city. He is a father of one son. He is a painter where he gets a low and unstable income due to low demand in the winter. Hafeth would like to be independent and open his own business. 

Fafeth took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new painting tools for his new business. This will help him to increase his productivity and also his income. 

Hafeth appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new painting tools for his new business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old, single man from Tubas, a village near Nablus city. He is a paint worker where he gets a low and unstable income due to the low demand in the winter. He would like to be independent and open his own business. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new paint tools for his new business. This will help him to increase his productivity and also his income.  Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new paint tools for his new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new paint tools for his new business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma's second loan with Kiva. She is  in the agricultural business with her son, daughter-in-law and grandchild.  They live in the village of Akhuryan. 

Her first loan  helped her to overcome some difficulties with her farm and she bought potatoes and made a good profit. She  grows and sells wheat.

Emma decided to increase potato production. She requests a second loan from Kiva and hopes that this new loan will have the same success as the previous one. She plans to purchase  fertilizer, seeds, and fuel.
 
Emma's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to underserved population of Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living. Shirak is considered to be a  poor region, with a high unemployment rate, and low living standards. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in Shirak region.

Emma thanks her Kiva lenders and she anticipates their support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 39 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Adelina has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for six years. In the future, Adelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai is 53 years old and lives with her husband and four children. For the past 30 years, Mai has been running a business of buying and selling recycled materials to earn an income to support her family. She is the leader of a loan group of four members who live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is standing on the right and wearing a white blazer.

All of the group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Mai is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of waste materials to recycle and resell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of waste materials to recycle and resell

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.en: Esperanca is  taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as  beer, water, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits and body lotion. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $400.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer, water, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits and body lotion

loans.name: Elvia Beatriz

texts.es: Elvia es una señora de 55 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 6 hijos pero todos ya son mayores de edad y son independiantes,Elvia vive con su esposo en una hacienda donde trabajan de cuidaderes de ganado, Elvia comenta que su patron de la hacienda les hace tener  hasta 3 ganados, por este motivo necesita el credito para comprar una vaca y despues va a ir comprando los demas ganados.  Elvia es una señora que junto a su esposo  aspira mejorar la calidad de vida y de ser posible apoyar a su hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Elvia is a 55-year-old woman who is married and has six children, all of whom are grown and independent. She and her husband live on a ranch where they work and take care of the cattle.

Elvia says that the ranch foreman has allowed them to have up to three head of cattle. For this reason, she needs a loan in order to buy a cow. Afterwards she will buy the other cattle. Elvia is a woman who aspires to improve her quality of life with her husband so that it is possible for them to support their children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A loan of $800 is offered to Maria to improve her business. She is married and she has a second-hand store where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as  trousers, shorts, and long-sleeved and short-sleeve garments. She has been involved in business activities since 2013. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shorts, and long-sleeved and short-sleeved garments

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz es una humilde trabajadora residente en el municipio de La Dorada con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. 

Hoy en día se gana la vida con la elaboración y venta de jugos de fruta, estas bebidas las transporta en una carretilla y los vende de manera ambulante.

Le dedica 8 horas diarias a su negocio.

De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo son las fuertes lluvias.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un triciclo y de pulpas de fruta para la preparación de sus bebidas, así podrá tener una mejor producción y mejor venta, de esta forma obtendrá los ingresos suficientes para continuar con su negocio y sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is a hard-working, humble woman who is a resident of the La Dorada municipality. She has a life full of dreams, hopes, and best wishes for her family.

Currently, she makes a living preparing and selling fruit juices. She transports her products in a pushcart and sells them on the street. She devotes eight hours every day to her business.

The main challenges she must face in her business are the heavy rainfalls. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fruit pulps to prepare her beverages, and a tricycle. This purchase will enable her to improve her production and sales, and generate enough income to stay in business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit pulps to prepare her beverages, and a tricycle.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
An $800 USD loan has been offered to Regina so she can improve her business. She opened her secondhand clothing store in 2010 through her own efforts.

Regina will use her loan to buy trousers, shorts, long- and short-sleeve shirts, and pillows. She is generating a good income from her sales.

Regina has been thinking of running a bigger business after years of involving herself in her current business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, long- and short-sleeve shirts and pillows.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 30 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as body lotion, cigarettes, sugar, salt, shampoo, biscuits, water, slippers, buckets and milk. 

She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.  Domingas is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, cigarettes, sugar, salt, shampoo, biscuits, water, slippers, buckets and milk.

loans.name: Wala

texts.en:
Wala is a 24-year-old married lady from Beddya, a village near the city of Nablus. She lives with her husband and one daughter in a small house. Her husband works as a construction worker, earning a low income. Three years ago, Wala opened a clothing store in the village, where she sells kids' clothes.

Wala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new collection of kids' clothing to resell. This will help her to improve her family living conditions and also her income.

Wala appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of kids' clothing to resell

loans.name: Kholod

texts.en:
Kholod is a 32-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. For the past seven years, Kholod has had a sewing workshop in her house. She takes orders from local traders.

Kholod would like to improve her business and expand it so she took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new machine for her workshop. This will increase her productivity and also her income.

Kholod appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for his new cafe.

loans.name: Felecidade

texts.pt:
Nasceu na província de Maputo tem 41 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha na Educação como Assistente Técnica a mais de 8 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa.  Dona Felicidade antes de começar a trabalhar com a hluvuku enfrentava várias dificuldades para terminar a sua obra de residência, pois trabalhando com a Hluvuku conseguiu erguer a sua obra, com o valor solicitado pretende adquirir uma geleira para sua casa. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência, mobiliar a sua casa e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior
texts.en: Felicidade was born in Maputo Province. She is 41 years old and a single mother of two children, both of whom are in school. Aside from her children, she has no other dependents. She has worked for over eight years as a Technical Assistant in the education sector, which has provided her with an income that goes toward her household expenses. Before connecting with Hluvuku, Felicidade met various obstacles in finishing work on her home, but with Hluvuku she has been able to carry on with her work. This will be her sixth loan with Hluvuku and she plans to use it to buy a freezer for her house. In the future she plans to finish with her home improvement work, furnish her house, and ensure her children's education through high school.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her house.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
La socia Libia pertenece al banco comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO.
La socia  sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo parabrisas, faros entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea continuar  trabajando en su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar faros entre otros.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Libia, the borrower, belongs to the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano. She continues dedicating herself to the business of selling auto parts for vehicles. She is a responsible and diligent person. She is still selling windshields, headlights, and more. She wants to go on working in her business so she can continue supporting her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy headlights and other items. 

She is grateful for the help to be offered and she promises to make the payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy headlights and other items

loans.name: Daher

texts.en:
Daher is a 58-year-old Lebanese married man with six children. He is the main income provider in the family, and his wife works from home selling homemade food. He has owned a plumbing and sanitary shop for eleven years. 

At this stage, Daher  is in real need of purchasing new tools and so he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase tools to enable him to best satisfy his customers' needs. Daher states that in the future, his loan will surely help him to diversify his supplies and increase his income by a good percentage.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his  plumbing and sanitary shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan, which she used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help toward her children's education and the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to be able to pay for the registration and maintenance of her tricycle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan plans to buy another jeepney to improve her transportation business. She wants her children to get a college education and hopes to see them become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the registration and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 46, is a single mother with three school-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for more than 10 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. Being the breadwinner, she experienced hardships in raising her children. 

Helen is still continuing the business, because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children. She already availed loans previously to purchase additional stocks and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.en:
Olimpia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a used clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Olimpia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of used clothes to sell.

Olimpia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mercelicia

texts.en:
Mercelicia is 60 years old, married, and has five children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mercelicia has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mercelicia has been in this business for 10 years now. She also earns additional income from a general store and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Gyumri town, where she lives with her husband and three children. She has chosen farming and agriculture as a source of earning a living for her family. Her plot of land is rich with harvest (wheat, barley and potato) that both feed her family and allows her to sell it at the wholesale market. 
After catastrophic earthquake in 1988, today Gyumri City almost does not remind anyone of the past, but each family here has its own loss and tragedy, which nobody can forget. 
Hasmik will be greatly thankful to receive this loan, which she will use for the purchase of fertilizer and fuel for cultivation works to boost farming business and earn income for the family. 
Hasmik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to underserved population of Shirak region, to help them to access market and earn living. It is very important for Hasmik and her family to receive lenders' support and invest funds on their farm.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and fuel for cultivation works for her farming business.

loans.name: Manushak

texts.en:
Manushak is a married 55-years-old woman with 1 daughter.  They live in the Hovit village of Shirak region.

They have cows, calves, sheep, and chickens which enable the family to make profits selling milk, meat, and eggs. The family also cultivates wheat and sells it in local markets. 

Manushak requests a loan to purchase seeds and forage to feed the livestock, develop her farm and earn income to support the family.

Shirak is a poor region with a high unemployment rate and low living standards.
 
Lack of access to loans, bad market conditions, and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in Shirak region.
Manushak's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to underserved population of Shirak region, to help them to earn a living.

Manushak's dream is to develop her farm, earn income for her family, and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and forage to feed her livestock.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Ayub. Ayub lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about five hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ayub lives there with his wife and his five children. He owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business in another sector, which is technology. His community sees him as a trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Ayub needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Ayub’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Ayub is the one who is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ICT educational resources which will help the children in Maggie's school receive quality education using modern education technology.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Bayandur village of Shirak region with her husband, mother-in-law, daughter-in-law and little granddaughter.

Anahit and her family have been actively involved in agribusiness for many years. Her son used to live with the family and was a farmer previously, but he has since left that activity to his family and went abroad as a seasonal worker.

On the farm Anahit and her family keep livestock of cows, sheep, pig, hens and calves. Anahit's plot of land also is rich with harvests (wheat and barley) that both feed her big family and allow her to sell at the wholesale market.

Now, the sunny woman in the photo, Anahit has applied for this loan to pay for the renovation of the tractor aiming to boost her farm's productivity and get income for family's living. Anahit will be greatly thankful to receive this loan, which she will use for the development of the farm. Anahit hopes for lenders' support to her farming business.

Her loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to underserved population of Shirak region, to help them to access market and earn living.
Shirak is considered as poor region, where unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in Shirak region.

loans.use: to pay for tractor renovation aiming to boost her farm's productivity.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Due to an error in the repayment reporting process, Beatrice's first loan on Kiva was accidentally marked as fully repaid and contributing lenders were repaid their contribution. Because this was done in error and Beatrice still needs funding to purchase ICT educational resources for the students in her school, her loan is being reposted to Kiva to raise support again from lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ZEduPads which are ICT educational resources which will help the children in her school receive quality education using this form of modern education technology.

loans.name: Dimakatso

texts.en:
Dimakatso (30) lives in Soweto with her three children aged 1, 7 and 10 years old. The older two children attend school daily. 

She was a domestic worker in a nearby household and that is where her interest in looking after children was born. Dimakatso now runs a daycare for young children who are not of school age and have parents who work during the day. 

She is requesting a loan to buy paint, cement, steel doors as well as roofing materials to upgrade two rooms at the daycare center to give the children a higher quality environment to play and learn. The improved standards will provide more safe places for young children during the day.

Her dream is to one day grow the daycare into a "Children's Center" where she can accommodate and educate children as well as keep them safe and healthy.

loans.use: to buy paint, cement, steel and roofing material

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas the 22 years old guy lives in the Palestinian refugee camp located in the North of Lebanon with his parents and 5 sisters and brothers; he is engaged and looking to build his own future. Firas is one of the Palestinian refugees who is working with the local Palestinian NGO inside the camp and he is a constructor at the same time. 
He is asking for a 1,029,988 Lebanese Pound loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa to buy a crane in order to develop his work and save the cost of the crane's rent; all this will help Firas to increase his profit, productivity and create new job opportunities. 
Firas is educated, hard-worker and fighter, he keeps helping his family and aiming to build his future, especially that he doesn't own a house in the camp.

loans.use: To buy a new crane

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Living in the Palestinian camp located in the North of Lebanon with his wife and 3 kids, Haitham is a 50 year old  building contractor. After working as an employee for several years, Haitham became independent in 1996 and started working on his own with a wide range of experience. 
In order to develop his work and maintain the stability and continuity of his projects, Haitham needs a 1,234,994 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva's field partner Ibdaa to buy a new crane. He is looking for hiring new workers and taking more projects. Haitham's interest is to provide all his family's needs, he is a fighter and has a very good reputation in his environment.

loans.use: To buy a new Crane

loans.name: Hend

texts.en: Hend is 27 years old and is from Baniswef. She lives with her father and runs a clothing project to help her father with the family income. She requested two consecutive loans from TADE and successfully repaid them on the due dates. Now, she wants to expand her project and increase her income by taking another 7,000 EGP loan to buy more clothing for her project.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her project.

loans.name: Milad

texts.en: Milad is 35 years old and is from Baniswef. He is married to a housewife and has two school children. The only source of income for his family is a grocery store project. The project is very small and needs to be developed. Therefore, Milad requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy a fridge and some products such as oil, pasta and rice for his store to expand his project and increase his sales.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and some products such as oil, pasta and rice for his store.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en: Ramadan is 31 years old and from Baniswef. He is married to a housewife and has five children. He works as a construction carpenter. He requested a loan from TADE at the beginning of his career and started his project and then he requested another loan and developed his project. Ramadan successfully repaid both loans on the due dates and requested another 15,000 EGP loan to buy more wood to expand his business and implement full buildings independently.

loans.use: To buy more wood to expand his business and implement full buildings independently.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 30 years old and from Baniswef. He is married to a housewife. The only source of income to the family is a fresh juice shop. Mahmoud wishes he could expand his project and increase his sales by purchasing an ice cream machine. Therefore, he requested a 3,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy an ice cream machine to expand his business and increase his sales.

loans.use: To buy an ice cream machine to expand his business and increase his sales.

loans.name: Jepun Sari Group

texts.en:
The Jepun Sari group can pay off the loan well. Repayment is represented by Ni Ketut, head of the group. In general, all members can keep pigs well, helping them not to be attacked by disease. They provide the feed mixture to reduce costs. The whole pig is sold and they earn enough profits to finance the family's needs and save for the future.

Ni Ketut sold all the piglets after the sow gave birth (10 piglets) and earned a satisfactory profit. The income from this effort she saved for venture capital. She is very grateful to MUK and Kiva lenders for the assistance of funds provided.

Because the prices of feeds are high, the Jepun Sari group requested another loan of the same amount. At the time of disbursement of funds in the field, two members could not attend due to several reasons. Each member gets 3,000,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy high quality piglets and feed.
Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy quality feed to increase the growth of the pigs. To reduce costs, she still gives them mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not be attacked by disease. If she already has enough savings, she will raise pigs with her own capital.

One member decide to resign and she was replaced by a new member.

loans.use: to buy quality feed to increase the growth of the pigs

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: In 2012, Divina learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives for business start-ups. Divina tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital for her corn farm. Divina would like to borrow another amount to pay for fertilizer and pesticides for her corn farm. This will give her farming income a big boost. Divina looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and pesticides for her corn farm.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Hijas De Dios Group

texts.es:
La líder del grupo es Maríanela tiene 38 años de edad, es nicaragüense con más de 20 años de vivir en Costa Rica, vive con su compañero y sus 3 hijos, dos de ellos son estudiantes, 1 en primaria y 1 en secundaria. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que se ha esforzado por salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  Comerciante con mucha experiencia, vende ropa, perfumes, y productos de catalogo. El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de más mercadería por catálogos para poder cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes ya que no ha podido satisfacer a los mismos por falta de dinero, eso le va a permitir ampliar su cartera de clientes así como aumentar sus ingresos por ventas. Doña Marianela con mucho entusiasmo y ganas de trabajar sabe que el crédito es de mucha ayuda para ella y su familia, ya que le va a permitir acercarse a cumplir sus sueños, que son ver a sus hijos concluir sus estudios y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. 
En el banco mujer Las Hijas de Dios hay junto con Maria Nela cuatro socias más, las cuales van a invertir en comercio todas. Escogieron éste nombre porque se sienten identificadas. En su primer crédito mostraron puntualidad y cumplieron las reglas de oro.
Todas buscan crecer en sus actividades productivas para aumentar sus ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The leader of the group is 38-year-old Maríanela, a Nicaraguan who has lived in Costa Rica for more than 20 years.  She lives with her partner and their three children. Two of her children are students; one is in primary school and one is in high school.  She is a very hard-working woman who has pushed herself to get ahead in life and to improve her living conditions.  She is a salesperson with a lot of experience selling clothing, perfume, and products out of a catalog.  

She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise from catalogs so that she can complete the orders that her clients have made. She has not been able to fill them due to her lack of money.  This will allow her to expand her portfolio of customers and thus increase her income through her sales.  Doña Maríanela has great enthusiasm and a desire to work.  She knows that the loan will be a great help to herself and her family because it will allow her to get close to accomplishing her dreams, which are to see her children finish their schooling and to improve the conditions of their home.

The group Banco Mujer Las Hijas de Dios (The Daughters of God Women's Bank) has four other members in addition to Maríanela.  All of them are going to invest in commerce.  They chose this name because they identify with it.  With their first loan they showed punctuality and followed the Golden Rule.  All of the women are looking to grow their productive jobs in order to increase their income and help their family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise from catalogs so that she can complete the orders that her clients have made.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María, tiene la edad  de 41 años, está casado,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de frijoles y así que tenga un buen desarrollo de la plantacion, además pagar mano de obra en la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación en desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la propiedad para el cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el cultivo de frijol. Además de poder comprar los   mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha  que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is 41 years old, is married and lives with her husband and children, who are her top priority. 

With the loan she intends to purchase fertilizers and other products to apply to the cultivation of beans so that the plantation develops well.  In addition, to pay for labor for the implementation of products and the help during the plantation's development, and thus make sure the job is done properly. 

She aims to take advantage of good weather and soil conditions which the property has for farming, and also implement several years experience in the management of beans.

In addition she wants to be able to buy the best products with the best quality so that her plantation has good development and health as well as an adequate harvest, and have good production in the short-term. 

The income from the expected harvest she would like to apply to the studies and welfare of her family and meet some family goals and continue to invest more in her crops. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She never had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with greater ease and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: in her bean planting.

loans.name: Paloma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Paloma works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Paloma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, bamboo, and maintenance for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Paloma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, bamboo, and maintenance for her boat, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Marc A Group

texts.fr: Mumbesa  est commerçante, membre  du groupe solidaire «Marc A», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un douanier, âgée de 32 ans, mère 2 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une mini quincaillerie sur une route secondaire de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle va acheter  des balais, raclettes, tôles, clous, ciments, tuyaux, etc. Elle  souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mumbesa  is a small-scale merchant and a member of the solidarity group called Marc A. Group.  She is a client of the MFI Hekima, married to a customs agent, aged 32, mother of two children, both enrolled in school. 

Mumbesa began her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been the owner of a mini hardware store on a secondary road in the town for four years. She is going to buy brooms, floor scrapers, metal roofing sheets, nails, cement, pipes, etc. She hopes to grow her turnover, keep her children in school and feed them. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who cannot access conventional banking services.

loans.use: to buy brooms, floor scrapers, metal roofing sheets, nails, cement, pipes, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, together with her husband and three children, lives in Saralanj village of Shirak region. She runs their family farm. Her husband is a seasonal migrant worker, so Emma has to take care of their farming business alone. The farm is not rich and cultivated products are mainly for family use. Emma cultivates potatoes, carrots, onions, and garlic and keeps two cows and two calves.

With her professional skills in farming, Emma does her best to be useful, to keep the children healthy, and to provide minimum living conditions for them. She has applied for this loan to purchase forage to feed the livestock and seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation. 

Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people developing their businesses in the Shirak region. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Emma's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living. 

Despite the bad socioeconomic conditions in the village, Emma says she wants to stay in her motherland and be an example for all the young families to work and develop their country.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Carmen Amabel

texts.es:
Carmen, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, porque su padre falleció y tenían muchas necesidades, fue por eso que decidió abandonar la escuela y empezar a trabajar, para ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar y que a sus hermanitos no les faltara nada.- Ella nunca se casó y no tiene hijos, solo vive con una sobrina y los dos hijos de ella.

Carmen, es una mujer luchadora y con muchos deseos de superarse, desde que abandono la escuela inicio a trabajar en una tortillería cuando tenía 15 años de edad.- Tiempo después, su madre con mucho sacrificios logro colocar una pequeña tienda en su casa, pero desgraciadamente falleció al poco tiempo y fue Carmen, quien continuo con el pequeño negocio de su madre, ahora esa es su única fuente de ingresos.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar productos como arroz, frijol, azúcar, maíz, jabón, lejía, pan, huevos, leche, entre otros productos para la tienda. 

Carmen, sueña con hacer crecer su tienda, pero además le gustaría tener un negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Carmen, 51, went to school through sixth grade, because her father died and they had many needs. This is why she decided to leave school and start working in order to help her mother with household expenses so her younger siblings would not lack anything. She never married and has no children. She lives with her niece and her two children.

Carmen is a hardworking woman who wants to succeed. When she left school, she started working in a tortilla shop at the age of 15. Later and with great sacrifice, her mother was able to open a small store from home. Unfortunately, she passed away shortly after so this is how Carmen came to continue her mother's small business which is now her only source of income.

She will use the loan to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, corn, soap, bleach, bread, eggs, milk, among other products for her store. Carmen dreams of making her store grow, but also she would like to have a business selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, corn, soap, bleach, bread, eggs, milk, among other products for her store.

loans.name: Edinson Ernesto

texts.es:
Edinson ha tenido que soportar muchísimas adversidades en el proceso de desarrollo de su negocio.

Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa y se gana la vida vendiendo bolsos en la calle, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para sus 3 hijos.

Le dedica 9 horas diarias a su negocio.

El solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de surtido de bolsos en diversos estilos y tamaños para surtir su negocio.

Con este préstamo para ofrecer sus productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.

Es un hombre fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Edinson has encountered a lot of challenges in the process of developing his business. Nowadays, he lives in his humble home and earns his living selling bags in the street. He learned this trade in an empirical way, eager to support his 3 children.

He spends 9 hours daily in his business. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of bags of different styles and sizes to stock his business.  With this loan he can offer his products and improve his sales significantly.  He is a strong man with a great entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bags of different styles and sizes to stock his business.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is applying for a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She is married and she has four children.  She is running a business in her house by selling gasoline and diesel. She is making a good income from selling gasoline and diesel fuel and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. 

Jacinta opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of $600.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and diesel fuel

loans.name: Jose Isaias

texts.es:
José, de 28 años de edad, desde que tenía doce años de edad, trabajaba junto a su padre en la agricultura, porque por su condición económica era difícil continuar sus estudios, por esa razón no pudo asistir a la escuela.- Ahora se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la agricultura, tiene un hijo y una hija. 

José, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, ahora se dedica más a la ganadería porque es más rentable.

El dinero lo utilizara para comprar ganado de repasto y una yunta de bueyes para enseñarles a arar la tierra, para hacer más fácil su trabajo.

José, sueña con tener más ganado para crecerlos y venderlos a buen precio y de esa manera generar ingresos para su familia y darles el estudio a sus hijos, para que se graduen de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old. Since he was twelve years old, he worked with his father in agriculture, because due to his financial situation it was difficult to continue going to school. Because of this, he was not able to attend school. Nowadays, he works in animal husbandry and in agriculture. He has a son and a daughter.

Jose has worked in agriculture and raising cattle, now, he works more in animal husbandry because it is more profitable. He will use the loan to buy pasture cattle and a pair of oxen to train them how to plow the soil in order to make his work easier. José dreams of having more cattle in order to raise them and sell them at a good price, and in this way to generate more income for his family and to give his children an education so they graduate with a college education.

loans.use: to buy pasture cattle and a pair of oxen to train them how to plow the soil.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser owns an entertainment center in a popular street of a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. He is 28 years old, single and lives alone inside the camp. 
His clients and neighbors see him as an ambitious and hardworking young man as he is always looking to improve his business. Yaser is asking for a 1,799,994 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva field partner Ibdaa to buy new Playstation machine and display screens in order to attract more clients, which should lead to an increase of his profits. Yaser has a very good reputation in the camp and he is working on the continuity and development of his project.

loans.use: To buy a Play-Station and LCD screen

loans.name: Sokhoeun's Group

texts.en: Sokhoeun’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokhoeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida, no solo para ellas, sino también para todos sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, que se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité así ella y sus compañeras cuentan con una oportunidad de poder trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos son mujeres que desean mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias son conscientes que podrán superar con el deseo de cambiar con el esfuerzo. Ella se dedica a hacer artesanías, y con este humilde trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de pinturas, telas, hilos y otros insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías y seguir con ello mejorando cada día.
En la foto aparecen 19 mujeres, ya que el grupo tiene 19 miembros, pero solo 17 mujeres retiran préstamo, las otras dos firman como codeudoras y ahorristas.
texts.en:
This committee consists of women who are inspired to achieve a better quality of life, not only for themselves, but also for their loved ones.

One of the members is Sra. Sonia, who is pleased to be part of this committee. She and her fellow group members have an opportunity to work and generate their own incomes as women who want to improve the quality of life for their families. They are aware that they are capable of success, so they want things to change as a result of their efforts. Sonia makes handicrafts. Through this humble profession, she is able to earn a decent living.

Sonia is requesting a loan in order to buy paints, fabrics, thread, and other supplies so that she can continue producing her handicrafts. As a result, she can continue to improve each day. In the photo you can see 19 women, because the group has 19 members but only 17 women withdraw the loan, the other two Pictured 19 women appear, as the group has 19 members but only 17 women retire the loan, the other two signed as co-debtor and savers.

loans.use: to buy paints, fabrics, thread, and other supplies for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Tanjung Group is located in the north part of Bali, near the beach. Most of them work as a breeders, farmers and fishermen. Usually the women work as breeders or farmers and their husbands work as fishermen. 

Ni Ketut, who is 46, besides being a pig breeder, also helps her husband as a fisherman. Ni Ketut sells the fish house-to-house on foot. Ni Ketut maintained nine pigs and she has sold them all for 750,000 IDR each. She earned enough money to make payments, fulfil the family needs and make savings. 

Most of the members receive a maximum result because they always give the pigs good feed and vitamins. Sumber Tanjung Group is requesting a new loan, which they will use it to increase their breeding and fish businesses. 

Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase superior piglets, feed and more fish from other fisherman to sell. To reduce the cost, the pigs can be given small fish and banana leaves for feed. She hopes for the best, and her goals are to have enough savings to use for business capital. 

In the photo two members couldn't attend because of a religious ceremony at the temple.(4 additional persons at the picture, standing behind the group member, are not received the loan. They are children of the member)

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets, feed and more fish from other fisherman to sell

loans.name: Sumber Bunga Group

texts.en:
One month ago, Wayan, head of the Sumber Bunga group, already informed the 10 members to prepare for repayment of the 15,000,000 IDR loan amount. Wayan succeeded to sell five pigs with the price of 4,500,000 IDR and the remaining 1 pig to be sold in a few weeks. With the profits of 1,500,000 IDR, she is very grateful for the acquisition and will use the profits for the preparation of her children’s education and also their daily needs.

With 10 members, the Sumber Bunga wants to continue with their loan of 15,000,000 IDR and each will receive 1,500,000 IDR. They decided to continue the loan until they have enough savings. Wayan will use her loan to purchase superior feed and fix her cage. She already has two sows. According to her plan, the piglets will be born in a few weeks. She must prepare for that. She has a plan to become a piglet seller, especially local pigs. She hopes her plan will come true, and that she can improve her business by selling piglets to other breeders.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and to fix the pig cage.

loans.name: Hiperbanco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HIPERBANCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Violeta, la socia continua dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de docente del nivel primario, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua trabajando en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres para su hogar como leche, azúcar, menestras, aceite.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “HIPERBANCO” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This member continues to work in the local Cusco schools and this is how she gets her family ahead.

Violeta continues to work as an elementary school teacher and is grateful to those who form part of this dream in this manner.  She promises to make her payments on time.  

She is asking for a loan to buy food for her home, such as milk, sugar, soups, and cooking oil.

The members added to the photo were not able to be there when it was taken, due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en: Bibiana is 46 years old, married and has five children. She and her spouse are farmers, planting and harvesting rice to sell. Bibiana needs continuous maintenance for her crops so they will produce an abundant harvest and gain good profits for the farming business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help improve her crop production. Bibiana will continue to improve her crop output and save funds for the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, age 59. She is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and already has grandchildren from some of her children. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rebecca operates a radiator shop that offers various services, such as overhauling, repairs, tube replacement and fabrication of radiators. Her Shop is located in a busy commercial area. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in service fees every day. 

To help her to continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to pay for the maintenance of her equipment and some supplies needed for her radiator shop. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help, and hopes for a good return on her investment, for it will surely cover her family's daily needs.

Rebecca hopes to be successful in her business. She prays for a better life and for good health for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and, there, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of equipment in her radiator shop.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old, married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Carmelita has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lordita

texts.en:
Lordita is 59 years old and is married with 4 children. She earns a living with her pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Lordita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Lordita has been running her pig fattening business for 5 years now, though she also earns additional income from fish vending .

Lordita is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Esther Josefina

texts.es: Josefina es una señora casada que esta pasando por sus 49 años de edad, Josefina tiene 5 hijos de ellos son los dos menores que tienen 12 y 16 años quienes están estudiando, el esposo de Josefina  trabaja al jornal y hay días que le ayuda en el negocio a Josefina, ella va a  invertir el dinero del credito en la compra de pollo, papas, arroz, carne, verduras para ensaladas y mas productos para preparar sea almuerzos y mas comidas que ofrece en su restaurante. Esta señora trabajadora tiene la aspiración de que su negocio sea mas grande muy atractivo y rentable, para de este mejorar sus ingresos para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Josefina is a married woman who is turning 49 years old. Josefina has five children, and the youngest two who are 12 and 16 years old are in school. Josefina’s husband works as a day laborer and there are days when he helps Josefina with her business. She is going to invest the loan money into buying chicken, potato, meat, vegetables for salads and more products to make such as lunches and more foods to offer in her restaurant. This hardworking woman has the aspiration to make her business larger, very attractive, and profitable, and in this way improve her income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy chicken, potato, meat, vegetables and more products.

loans.name: Kristine Joy

texts.en:
Kristine Joy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Kristine Joy requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Kristine Joy has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has five children who are presently in school. Ma. Theresa has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. Ma. Theresa has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.es: 34 años de edad  es la edad de Marlon, un hombre se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, como útiles escolares víveres y variedades de accesorios femeninos y para el hogar. Su experiencia data de muchos años, cuando por tradición familiar, transmitida de generación en generación  por parte de su abuela y de su madre y sus hermanos, decidió generar sus propios ingresos en el año 1995, vendiendo ropa y calzado, y poco a poco ha agregado otros productos a sus inventarios.  Su meta es continuar generando bienestar familiar y ampliar su negocio para generar ingresos que le permitan lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  útles escolares, víveres, variedades, accesorios femeninos,  con esta compra mejorará sus tiempos de respuesta, generando más garantías de servicio, credibilidad y cumplimiento, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Marlon is 34 years old. He's a man who makes a living selling a variety of merchandise such as: school supplies, food and a a range of feminine and household accessories. 

He has many years of experience in the trade due to it being a family tradition which has been passed down from generation to generation from his grandmother to his mother to himself and his siblings. In 1995 he decided to make his own income by selling clothes and underwear and little by little he has added other products to his inventory. 

His goal is to continue improving his family's wellbeing and to make an income which allows him to expand his business. At the moment he is applying to CREDIKIVA for the first loan that the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation are offering. He will use the loan to buy school supplies, beverages, and feminine accesories to improve his response times and credibility and generate a better guarantee of service and performance. By doing this he will make the investment from CREDIKIVA successful.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, food, and women's accessories,

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 28 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell such as coffee, spices, canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, cooking oil and personal care products.

Jinky has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from E-Loading.

Jinky aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as coffee, spices, canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar,  cooking oil and personal care products

loans.name: Johnrel

texts.en:
Johnrel is a 20-year old vocational graduate and lives in a rural village in Bago City. His father already passed away, and his mother is the one taking care of their brod of seven. Johnrel's eldest sister and brother are both married, his two brothers work for a call center, while the other two are unemployed. 

Johnrel dreams of working in a call center and having a stable job. Your generosity in funding his loan will help Johnrel have a better income in the coming months and have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call-center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en: Khun’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Khun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Neil

texts.en:
Neil is a 19-year old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. He belongs to a family of six. His father Alfredo is a farmer, and his mother is a housewife. Neil has three siblings. He is the third in their family. His eldest sister is already married, his elder brother is unemployed, and his youngest brother is still in high school. Their total monthly family income of Php 5,000 ($113) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. 

This motivates Neil to find the means to help the family have more income; that's why he braved the selection process of BagoSphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the two-month training program that could lead to a call center job. 

Neil dreams to have a better future. Your generosity in funding his loan will help Neil have a better income in the coming months, and to achieve and be more fulfilled, and to improve his overall quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Sarun is aged 58. He is living in a rural village of the Phnom Proek district and has five children. He and his wife have been growing cassava and working for others for a fee. They have been in this business for 12 years.

This is the micro loan for Sarun’s group with VisionFund. He has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The past two loans that he completely repaid have helped him relieve financial burden and improve his livelihood. 

Now requesting a loan, Sarun, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his cassava. He hopes to produce more crops from his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his cassava

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Sophal’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nuulua

texts.en: Nuulua is 20 years old and single with one child. She runs a small business selling pancakes, noodles, and snacks  in her community and has been doing this for three years. Nuulua has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, yeast, a frying pan, a cooking pot, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Nuulua will save her profit to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, yeast, a frying pan, a cooking pot, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, and containers.

loans.name: Nareman

texts.en:
Nareman is a 21-year-old single lady from Bethlehem city. Her mother works as an employee in the public sector where she gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.

Nareman is a student in the university where she studies hotel management. She wants to complete her studies and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions.

Nareman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay her university installments for this semester. This will help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Nareman appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay her university installments for this semester

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza está en su ciclo número 2, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
Una de las personas que se destaca es la Sra. Romelia quien se dedica a la venta de frutas, es muy buena vendedora, es por ello que le va muy bien, además de que siempre tiene productos muy variados y frescos que ofrece a sus clientes.
La Sra. Romelia pide este préstamo para la  compra de Verduras, Frutas y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más productos y más venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en: "La Esperanza" Group is in its second loan cycle, where all members are within the program of poverty elimination which will allow them to improve their life conditions and those of their families. Romelia is one of its members. She works selling fruits. She is a very good saleswoman, and this is why she is doing very well. Also, she always has very diverse and fresh products that she offers to her customers. Romelia is requesting this loan to buy vegetables and fruits which will help her have more products and more sales, and help her improve her income. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting to be able to grow.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Sagrada Familia 2 forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde las 17 mujeres están poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Todas las integrantes son muy trabajadoras, pero se destaca la Sra. Alodia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, ella es una persona muy emprendedora, que está poniendo todo de sí para poder ir creciendo poco a poco y por medio de las capacitaciones y el programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas para la venta y así ir creciendo en su pequeño emprendimiento poco a poco.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Sagrada Familia 2 is part of the poverty elimination program, where 17 women give all they've got so they can grow and move forward. All members are very hard-working, but Alodia stands out. 

She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables and through her work she has the means to support her family. She is a very entrepreneurial woman, who gives her all to be able to grow little by little through training and the program of entrepreneurial women. She is requesting this loan to be able to by fresh fruits and vegetables to sell, and in this way to grow her small undertaking, little by little.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a small humble house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, where he makes a low income. Mohammad is a student in a local university studying science. He wants to complete his studies and find a job in the future.

Mohammad took out a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to do his homework and write reports easily.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies in science

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de peluches de toda clase en las ferias que se realizan en los pueblos aledaños, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a las ventas las cuales le han dejado buenas ganancias para cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive con su esposa y su hijo  en casa propia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para surtir mas el negocio y así atraer más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The young man's face was blurred because he is 28 years old and lives in an area of high risk. He makes a living selling stuffed animals of all kinds at the festivals that are held in suburban towns. He has been making a living at these sales for five years, which have provided him with good earnings to cover some household expenses. The young man lives with his wife and his son in their own house. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise in bulk to increase his business' stock in order to attract more customers and improve his income to have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Jempiring Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan is the head of the Jempiring Group. She makes a daily living as a pig farmer. She lives with her husband and a child. Ni Wayan is trying to develop a pig business by borrowing 3.000.000 IDR. from MUK and total loan 30.000.000 IDR for the Jempiring group.

From the sale of 10 pigs in this period, Ni Wayan managed to get a satisfactory profit. The gain is very helpful to the family's finances, which are currently experiencing difficult times due to increasingly expensive necessities of life.

Ni Wayan with the Jempiring Group decided to continue borrowing from MUK because it is especially helpful in developing the pig business.
 
Ni Wayan wants to increase her business by keep local pigs for pig barbecues. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs. Ni Wayan will also use her portion of the loan to buy feed and renovate the cage. 

She still has a superior quality sow. The pigs for the pig barbecue usually only keep for two or three months and then are sold. Her husband supports her business by helping her to give feed and clean the cage. Ni Wayan save her profit, because she has a dream to renovate her kitchen.

One member decide to resign and she was replaced by a new member. Two members are not pictured because one is having a baby and one has a religious ceremony at her house.

loans.use: to purchase three local pigs, feed and renovation the cage

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 56 years old, married and has six children. She lives in Tudela in Misamis Occidental.

Lea decided to start raising pigs after she found Paglaum MPC would help her with financial assistance for her business. Lea has maintained her membership in good standing with no loan defaults. She has taken out several loans, and all were paid in a timely manner.

Lea recently applied for a 7,000 PHP loan to buy bags of feed and vitamins for her growing hogs, which should result in a boost in her income. Lea wishes to manage her business continuously and more effectively so that she can provide a better living for her family.
