loans.use: to buy bags of feed and vitamins for her growing hogs

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 96 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 96 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. Ils regroupe 5 personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier et font pratiquement les mêmes activités. Ils se réunissent aussi chaque fin de mois et ont choisi comme présidente Madame Wekhouté. C'est elle qui a levée la main sur la photo, elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation du charbon de bois. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter du charbon de bois pour revenir les vendre en détail dans le quartier. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Wekhouté aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité des ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l'avenir elle souhaiterai avoir un grand magasin de stockage de charbon pour pouvoir augmenter son stock et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi elle pourra épargner de l'argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jiguène Bakhna 96 is a sub-group of  “Association des Femmes Commerçantes” of Pout. It comprises five persons, who all live in the same district and practically have the same businesses. The group members also meet at the end of each month, and they have chosen Ms. Wekhouté as their president. She is the one with a hand raised in the photo. She is a married mother of a family who works at selling charcoal. 

Wekhouté is requesting this sum of money to purchase some charcoal to bring back and sell at the retail level in her neighborhood. She has over five years of experience in this business. She helps out her husband in managing day-to-day expenses and her children’s schooling costs. Her day starts at 8 AM and ends at 7 PM.  

For the future, she would like to have a big warehouse for charcoal to be able to increase her inventory and her revenues. Thus, she will be able to save some money and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell retail

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en: Orifjon is a bright man. He was born in the southwestern part of Tajikistan in 1995. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a second-year student at university. After graduating from high school, Orifjon decided to be a philologist. He studies excellently and wants to graduate well and find good work. He needs to pay his university tuition fee and is asking for a loan from KIVA lenders. He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fee

loans.name: William

texts.en: William lives in Enrile with his family. He is managing a repair shop(for bicycles and motorcycles) for income. He has been in his business for over 10 years and he has gained regular customers because of the good services he offers. William wants to continue offering good services, that is why he is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional revolving capital in improving his business. He will buy tires, oils and tools to use in the repair shop. He hopes to improve his income for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy tires, oils and tools to use in the repair shop

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nenita works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items like soft drinks, sardines, sugar, chips, etc. to sell at her general store.

Nenita successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested another loan to further build her business. Nenita has been sustaining her business activities with NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items like soft drinks, sardines, sugar, chips, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 40 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Armin

texts.en:
Armin works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Armin has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as cooking oil, spices, flour, bananas, meat and other supplies for her food production business.

Armin has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from a general store and buy-and-sell ready-to-wear. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as cooking oil, spices, flour, bananas, meat and other supplies for her food production business.

loans.name: Ninda

texts.en:
Ninda works hard to support her family. She is single and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Ninda has been in this business for two years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Romelita

texts.en:
Romelita is a married woman and she is 38 years old with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Romelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Romelita has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, bamboo, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 59 years old and widowed with five children. With one child is still in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell such as canned goods, spices, noodles, milk, coffee, cooking oil, and also personal care products.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell such as canned goods, spices, noodles, milk, coffee, cooking oil and also personal care products.

loans.name: Titalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Titalyn works hard to support her family. She has a rice mill business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Titalyn is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill business.

Titalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

loans.name: Phong's Group

texts.en:
Phong, born in 1995, is the Thai ethnic man. He has been participating in the program of M7-MFI since the year of 2014, and he is the only man at his group. He is living with his wife in Mai Son district, Son La province.
	His family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the expenses of the family after deducting costs. He has saved a little amount, but it is not enough to buy materials for repairing his house. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan to buy materials to repair his house.
	He really hopes the loan amount will help his family have favorable conditions to repair the house, making it more spacious and cleaner. He will try to find an extra job to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his house

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben is a sixty-six-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

Lauben deals in livestock whereby he rears cows for fattening alongside a retail shop to earn him extra income. He started this business to earn enough money to educate his children. 

He hopes to expand his business, however his main challenge is diseases that attack his animals. 

Lauben is requesting a loan to buy more bulls for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en: Dy’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Dy makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Savan's Group

texts.en: Savan’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savan makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her husband's broken wagon used in his shop.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
The Sari Mertha group can repay their loan on time. Ni Luh, as head of the group, told of her success in raising pigs. From her first loan from MUK, Ni Luh had one pig, but now she has five pigs. Ni Luh sold the pigs after maintaining them for six months. She also has a sow with six piglets. She saved all her profits and they will be used for working capital, so that she can be independent in terms of capital. For now, she still can’t renovate her house. She is still saving for that. Ni Luh is very grateful for the help she has received so far. She still expects the assistance from MUK, both in terms of capital and training, so that she and all members of the group can be successful pig farmers.

After obtaining satisfactory results in the previous loan period, the Sari Mertha group will continue borrowing. The current loan will be used to purchase piglets, feed and to repair cages. Because Ni Luh as the head can’t attend the meeting because of a religious ceremony in her temple, Ni Ketut as the Secretary will be the representative at the disbursement for the Sari Mertha group. Ni Ketut has two children, one of them still in school. Ni Ketut pursues two businesses, pigs and a small kiosk. Ni Ketut still has four piglets in her cage. She’ll use the loan to buy feed, repair cages and to purchase some merchandises for her kiosk. She hopes the welfare of her family will be better, and if all goes well, she will stop borrowing and continue the business with her own money. 

One member must resign from the group because she will follow her husband to the city. Her husband has new job there.

loans.use: to buy feed, repair cages, and to purchase some merchandise for her kiosk.

loans.name: Ivy  Fe

texts.en: Ivy Fe has considerably prepared for the post-harvest operations of her palay in Molave. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. Ivy Fe presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and made a loan. She hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for the post-harvest operations of her palay (rice)

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC, which rescued her by lending her money when she needed it the most. Farming is the main source of her income. 

Wilma has taken out another loan to pay for post-harvest operations of her palay in Molave. Wilma perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family. In the future, she wants to buy a hectare of rice land to expand her farming activities for possible business opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations of her palay (rice) in Molave

loans.name: Lilyn

texts.en:
Lilyn, 29 years old, is married and has one child. She lives in SWP, Calamba. Lilyn earns a living by offering manicure/pedicure services. She now has been in this business for about 3 years and is well known for the nice quality of services she offers. Lilyn has already purchased some new manicure sets and was able to save from it. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 3,000 per month. 

Lilyn is seeking a PHP 25,000 loan to purchase special items for her foot spa services. She has never had a delinquency in her previous loans. Lilyn is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase new sets of foot spas

loans.name: Corinne

texts.en:
Corinne is 33 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, spices, cooking oil, soft drinks, and also personal care products.

Corinne has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Corinne aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, spices, cooking oil, soft drinks and also personal care products.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Ntronang in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 62 years old and married with seven children. Four of his children are in senior high school and three of them are in primary school. 

Alex believes organic oil palm farming is environmentally sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects. He wishes to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. The extra income from his additional oil palms will not only allow him to continue funding his children’s education, but also provide him with an opportunity to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a fruit cleaner for Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill in Akim-Asuom, located in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 33 years old and married with three children. All her children attend primary school. 

Comfort is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through Fair Trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a microloan so that she can expand her organic oil palm field. This will help her fund her children’s education today while developing a property that will also yield fruit in years to come.

loans.use: to expand her oil palm field

loans.name: Ankomah

texts.en:
Ankomah is an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 55 years old and married with eight children. All of his children are receiving an education, ranging from primary school to post-secondary school. 

Ankomah believes in organic oil palm farming as an environmentally sustainable way to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. Selling additional fair trade & organic palm fruits will allow him to continue funding all of his children’s education while improving his community’s standard of living.

loans.use: top expand his oil palm field

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has an organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farm and lives in Bomso, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 47 years old and married with two children, one of which is in Senior High School and the other in primary school. 

Emmanuel believes organic oil palm farming is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children’s education and improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Expansion of Oil Palm Field

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 57 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in primary school.
 
Charles believes organic oil palm farming is a sustainable way to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field, allowing him to improve his family’s standard of living. At the same time, selling fair trade & organic palm fruit to Serendipalm supports projects in sanitation, health and education that serve his his community.

loans.use: for expansion of his oil palm field

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is an organic oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abodom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 33 years old and married with three children. All his children are in primary school. 

Eric believes selling Fair Trade & organic palm fruits to Serendipalm is profitable and helps protect the environment. He wishes to secure a microloan in order to expand his organic oil palm field, helping to create more development in his community while allowing him to continue paying for his children’s education.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a supervisor at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 28 years old and single.

Frank is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his oil palm field, and will use the extra income to support his parents and siblings.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Frederick is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and also grows organic oil palms. He lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 25 years old, single and without children.

Frederick is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his oil palm field. He plans to use the extra income to support his parents and siblings.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm fields

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified palm oil mill, and also grows organic palm oil. He lives in Kade in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. George is 46 years old and single.

George is interested in organic palm oil farming because it is environmentally sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his palm oil field, allowing him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic palm oil field.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and grows organic oil palms. She lives in Akim-Asuom, located in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 47 years old and divorced with two children. Her children attend high school.

Georgina is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through Fair Trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a microloan so that she can expand her organic oil palm field. This will help her fund her children’s education today while developing a property that will also yield fruit in years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field

loans.name: Kissiedu

texts.en:
Kissiedu has an organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farm and lives in Ntronang near Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 49 years old and married with five children. Two of his children are in high school and the others in primary school.

Kissiedu believes organic oil palm farming is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects.

He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. The additional income will allow him to continue providing for his family and to help finance his children’s education.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: 03080223000.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Oanh has worked in agriculture, raising cattle, for more than 10 years. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. 

Oanh, 39 years old, is married and has 2 children. She is the group leader of the 030802230001.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Oanh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2012 to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. With her business profit, Oanh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
La socia Genera  pertenece al banco comunal DIOS ES AMOR HABASPATA.
La socia tiene 45 años de edad  tiene 03 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito
La socia se siente agradecida  por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Genara is a member of the Communal Bank “Dios Es Amor Habaspata”. She is 45 years old, has three children, and is separated from her spouse. Genara divides her time between her daily activities and managing her grocery business. She has been in business for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her business. Genara wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. Therefore, she is requesting this loan.

Genera is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her household's daily needs and expenditures.

Flordeliz is very positive that she can further improve her business if you will let her borrow, once again, an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will be used for additional supplies of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed to increase product inventory. Simultaneously, Flordeliz could sustain the needs of her family through this assistance.

Flordeliz wants to expand her business so that she will be able to continue to support her family's needs. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita thanks you for your generosity because her previous loan helped her establish her business. That loan enabled her to purchase additional grocery products to increase her product inventory. Her business profits were used to provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Teresita is very positive that she can further improve her business with another 30,000 PHP loan. This new loan will be used to purchase additional stock, including groceries, toiletries, and beverages. By offering more items for sale, Teresita's customers will likely buy more products. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, this will allow Teresita to sustain her family's needs.

Aside from her variety store, Teresita offers photocopying services and sells prepaid loads for cellular phone users. She dreams that her family will always be completely happy. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, school supplies, and beverages for her business

loans.name: Jinnabil

texts.en:
Jinnabil is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has two children are still in school. Jinnabil has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, bamboo, and maintenance for her boat and other materials for her business.

Jinnabil has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, bamboo, and maintenance for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 50 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elsie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 64 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, bread, juice and also personal care products.

Victoria has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling bottled water. Victoria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, bread, juice and also personal care products.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en: Suzette, 35 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past five years, Suzette has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, Suzette would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marta Estela

texts.es:
Marta ha sido un ama de casa muy dedicada, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por su hijo ya que su esposo falleció; comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 1 año, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido de ropa de niño y dama al por mayor, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad de artículos, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Marta manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Marta has been a very dedicated housewife, always mindful of caring for her family which includes her son since her husband has passed away. She started selling goods a year ago, since she is responsible for carrying the financial burden of her home and she needs to generate the resources needed to do so.

Her customers are neighbors, family and friends from the area.  She works alone every day in her business and she finds that her work provides the benefit of her being able to care for her  family while at the same time managing to be productive as a trader.

Currently, she is requesting a loan to purchase assortment of clothes for boys and ladies wholesale, because it is a great opportunity at this time of year, this will allow her to stock up with more variety of items, resulting in better profits for her family.

Marta's greatest wish is to be able to continue supporting her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase assortment of clothes for boys and ladies wholesale.

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.en:
A USD 1,000 is offered to Lurdes to improve her business. She is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, body lotion, water, salt, eggs, oils, fish, and coffee. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Lurdes independent, because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, body lotion, water, salt, eggs, oils, fish, and coffee.

loans.name: Yeison Eduardo

texts.es:
Yeison, a sus 30 años de edad, es un hombre carismático, activo y servicial. Ser padre, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, comenzó a fabricar y comercializar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 

Trabaja todos los días durante 18 horas con 1 familiar.

Esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus negocio, pues comprará insumos como pega, clavos, suelas, cuero, entre otros, esto le ayudará a aumentar su producción y por ende mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Yeison manifiesta que le apasiona su trabajo, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en un gran distribuidor de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Yeison!
texts.en:
Yeison is 30 year old. He is a charismatic man who is active and helpful. Being a father was the main motive behind his tireless daily work, seeking alternatives to earning a living and providing for his children. Approximately 2 years ago he began to make and sell shoes for all kinds of customers. His shoes are of good quality, which enabled him to know the sector and experience success. He works 18 hours every day with 1 colleague. This inspired him to seek a loan to strengthen his business. He will buy supplies such as glue, nails, soles, leather and other items. this will help him increase his production and result in improved income from his work.

Yeison is passionate about his work, and he is always setting new goals and among them is to become a large shoe distributor and generate employment for others. In this way he will improve his quality of life and the well-being of his family, as well as the lives of those people who he helps do their daily labors.

Lend to Yeison's business!

loans.use: to buy supplies such as glue, nails, soles, leather and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Cherry

texts.en: Ma. Cherry, 42 years old, is married and has three children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past six years, Ma. Cherry has operated a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice and a weighing scale for her business. In the future, Ma. Cherry would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice and a weighing scale for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose se ha caracterizado entre sus clientes como un hombre amable y carismático, con 51 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, pues tiene una venta de helados en su casa que comenzó hace aproximadamente 20 años; allí tiene la ventaja de tener una muy buena ubicación.

Su experiencia en ventas la obtuvo trabajando empíricamente, por lo que su conocimiento en el manejo de comercio es amplio. 

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor de helados, conchas, servilletas, salsas, entre otros, así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diferentes gustos y necesidades; lo que le generará mejores ventas e ingresos para seguir luchando para cumplir su propósito a mediano plazo, que es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, en la que pueda compartir con su familia y que su negocio le genere mayor rentabilidad para dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is known among his customers as a friendly and charismatic man. He is 51 years old and has his own business selling ice cream from his home. He began this business approximately 20 years ago. He has the advantage of having a very good location. He gained his experience selling ice cream empirically, so his knowledge of managing the business is broad.

The loan he seeks will be used to buy stock at wholes such as ice cream, napkins, sauces, and other items. In this way he will have a greater variety to offer his customers and meet their likes and needs, resulting in greater income and sales in order to continue fighting to meet his goal. His goal is to improve the condition of his home so he can share it with family, and a second goal is that his business be profitable in order to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stock at wholesale of ice cream, napkins, sauces, and other items.

loans.name: Olga Miriam

texts.es:
Olga, de 57 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Bello, en este negocio vende almuerzos, desayunos, pasteles de pollo, empanadas, buñuelos, entre otros.

Olga trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder mejorar su vivienda y asegurar la sostenibilidad de su negocio. 

Enfrenta múltiples dificultades como la competencia en el sector.
Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar insumos como pollo, aceite, harina, entre otros.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olga is 57 year old and she opened a food business in her home which is located in Bello. She sells breakfasts, lunches, chicken pot pies, turnovers, fried pastries, and other items. She works every day from 6 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. She is a responsible, wise, and hard-working woman.

Among her dreams are to be able to improve her home and ensure the sustainability of her business. She has many challenges such as the competition in her field of business.

Olga seek help to have capital for her business in order to buy supplies such as chicken, oil, flour, and other items. The loan will impact her life and business in a favorable way so that she will be able to make her dream come true and she will have a greater variety of food to offer her customers. In addition, she supports her children with this business.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as chicken, oil, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
She is Marilyn. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had helped her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she can improve her business if you will lend her an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers are likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase on sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also make her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she can meet the needs of her family.

Marilyn hopes to grow her business as well as improve the living conditions of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell in her business.

loans.name: 030805190001.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Tỵ is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future. She works in agriculture raising poultry.

Tỵ is 64 years old and she is married with three children.  She is the group leader of the 030805190001.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. Tỵ lives  in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Tỵ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tỵ has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tỵ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tỵ hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Ernina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ernina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Ernina is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more sea foods to sell to customers.

Ernina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edna is 59 years old and has two children who are still in school. Edna has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Edna has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 17 Thôn 10 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Trung  is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Trung  is 51 years old.  She is married and has two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 17 thôn 10 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of nine members. 

In 2014, Trung  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Trung  has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Trung  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Trung  hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: 030102030002.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Xếp  works in agriculture raising cattle. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in future. She is 60 years old and she is married.  She has one child.  She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 030102030002.Thiệu Phú solidarity group.  Xếp lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Xếp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xếp has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Xếp hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more calves to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had helped her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of 40,000 PHP.  This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also make her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Ma. Lourdes also operates a house for rent which also serves as her additional source of income. She dreams to have business expansion soon and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Julenta

texts.en:
A $ 1500 loan is offered to Julenta to improve her business. She is married and she opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $100.00. She will use the loan to buy stock like cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water and body lotion to keep in her store. She is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business, and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water and body lotion

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. Elisa is married and has a furniture shop business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional woods, lumber, nails, and maintenance for her machine and other materials for her business.

Elisa has been in this business for 15 years now.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to puchase additional woods, lumber, nails, maintenance for her machine and other materials for her business

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rodelyn is 35 years old and all of her children are in school.

Rodelyn has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Rodelyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 48 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Jocelyn has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted vegetables such as squash, eggplant, onions, garlic, radishes and other vegetables to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables such as squash, eggplant, onions, garlic, radishes and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 52 years old.  She is married and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Paterna has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Paterna has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Paterna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $ 1,000 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock like slippers, biscuits, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, water, coffee and shampoo to keep in her store.  She is generating a good income from selling.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy slippers, biscuits, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, water, coffee and shampoo

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo MADRES UNIDAS, son  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Liliana es la presidenta del grupo, ella es ama de  casa, pero quiere ir implementando una nueva actividad para generar un ingreso extra para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de cosméticos y los artículos de limpieza para poder vender. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que no tiene miedo a ningún tipo de desafío, es por ello que hace todo tipo de actividades para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The MADRES UNIDAS group is from the city of San Ignacio. They are united and solidary, and work together on their businesses in order to help each other. 

Liliana is the president of the group. She is a housewife, but wants to start a new business so that she can generate extra income to help her loved ones. She is requesting this loan in order to buy cosmetics and cleaning supplies to sell. She is a very hardworking woman, who is not afraid of any kind of challenge. For this reason she takes on all types of jobs in order to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and cleaning supplies to resell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Sr. Victor es un comerciante independiente que se dedica exclusivamente a la venta de golosinas, tortitas, galletitas y dulces en una moto, contando con una clientela formada desde hace años que son las cantinas en los colegios, comercios, kioscos y despensas. 
Es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando para poder crecer y salir adelante, y con su trabajo tener los medios para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de golosinas, tortitas, galletitas y dulces y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Victor is an independent businessman who works exclusively selling snacks, chips, cookies, and sweets from a cart.  He has a customer base formed years ago including college cafeterias, businesses, kiosks and stores.  He is a very hardworking person that strives to be able to grow and succeed, and with his job to have the means to improve his quality of life.  He is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of snacks, chips, cookies, and candy to continue with his sales as he has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, chips, cookies, and candy to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso Group

texts.es:
“Mujeres en Progreso” está en su  ciclo 15 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felicita, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es un decir, en un nivel de pobreza extremo. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de las ventas que hace en su despensa tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella comenta que con mucho sacrificio ha ido creciendo, y es por ello que pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa, y poder comprar yerba, aceite, panificados, etc., y con ello poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena variedad.
texts.en:
“Mujeres en Progreso” (Women in Progress) is in the 15th cycle of the women committee program, where all the members have committed to work and help each other succeed. They are conducting a poverty elimination survey as a means of understanding each one’s situation, to then improve their living conditions accordingly.

One of the members is Mrs. Felicita, whose survey shows a poverty level 1, meaning a very extreme level of poverty. Through effort, continuous work and the sales at her small grocery store, she has the earnings to be able to help her family. She notes that she’s been growing her business with a lot of sacrifice and this being the reason she is requesting a loan, which will allow her to stock up her store by buying yerba mate tea, oil, bread, etc. and thus continue to offer her clients a good variety of items.

loans.use: buy yerba mate tea, oil, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al  banco comunal “Apu Asangani”.
El socio Nicolas tiene 35 años de edad es soltero y tiene 02  hijos, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura y venta de cereales, el socio  lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio  solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Nicolas is a member of the Apu Asangani community bank.  He is 35 years old, single, and has two children.  He balances his daily activities with farming and grain sales.  He has been doing this work for many years thanks to the effort that he puts into it every day.  He is a responsible and enterprising person who is moving his family forward with his work.

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

He is grateful for this loan and values it.  He promises to make his monthly repayments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor”  conformada por 06 socias entusiastas. Este el caso de  Teresa de 47 años de edad separada con 03 hijos. Con los deseos de superarse teresa emprende el negocio de venta de comidas, la cual se viene desempeñando hace más de 04 años.  Con perseverancia y esfuerzo ha mejorado su vivienda. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos y menestras.  Mejorar su negocio es su siguiente meta. El grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” está agradecido por la ayuda brindada. Teresa se encuentra sentada es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo color verde.
texts.en:
This is the group "Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor" ["Women for a Better Future "] comprised of six enthusiastic members. This is the case of Teresa, who is forty-seven years old and separated with three children. With the desire to get ahead, she runs her business selling meals, which she has done for over four years. With perseverance and effort she has improved her circumstances. The loan she is seeking will be used to purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles and vegetables. Improving her business is her next goal. 

The group "Women for a Better Future" is grateful for the support. Teresa is seated third from the right, wearing a green shirt.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles and vegetables

loans.name: Jose Jhonny

texts.es:
Jose es un joven hombre de 18 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de gastronomía. 
Él es inteligente, responsable, comprometido, constante, atento, y muy estudioso. Sus estudios lo realiza en un instituto técnico de excelencia situado en la ciudad, un lugar caracterizado por el comercio y manufactura en todos los rubros, donde; restaurantes, librerías, hoteles, mercados, oficinas, galerías, universidades, etc., conviven lado a lado, de clima subtropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18 – 32 grados centígrados.
Jose es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, complexión física delgada, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Su vida la comparte junto a sus padres que trabajan como comerciantes y su madre tiene una librería, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de energía eléctrica, agua extraída de pozo y alcantarillado. El cursa la carrera de gastronomía y se encuentra en 1 año de 3 años que dura la carrera. Él disfruta los sabores de una comida caliente, le gusta compartir los aromas de la cocina, su carácter es de servicio. “escogí esta carrera porque es corta y me permitirá trabajar rápidamente…” comenta. La ventaja de sus estudios es que la demanda del lugar exige gente de su rubro profesional, la desventaja es el tiempo que aún le falta para terminar de estudiar, Su sueño es ser profesional para conseguir un buen empleo y desea comprar utensilios e insumos de cocina, como; cubiertos, cuchillos, ollas, sartenes, guardapolvos, etc. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para comprar utensilios e insumos de cocina para continuar y terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Jose is a young man who is 18 years old, single, without children, and he is studying for a degree in gastronomy. 
He is smart, responsible, committed, diligent, attentive, and very studious. He does his studies in a technical institute of excellence located in the city, a place characterized by commerce and manufacturing in all areas, where restaurants, bookstores, hotels, markets, offices, galleries, universities, etc. coexist next to each other. It has a subtropical climate with a temperature that changes during the day from 18-32 degrees centigrade.
Jose is dark-skinned, with brown eyes, short black hair, thin physical body shape, and low height. His mother tongue is  Quechua, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish as general culture and because of the studies he does. He shares his life with his parents who work in retail, and his mother has a bookstore. They live together in a house they own made of adobe with an iron roof. It has electricity, water from a well, and a sewage system. 
He is doing a gastronomy degree, and he is in the first of three years that the degree takes. He enjoys the flavors of a hot meal, he likes to share the scents of the kitchen, and his character is that of service. “I choose this career because it is short, and it will allow me to find work quickly…” he says. The advantage of his studies is that there is a demand in the city for people with his professional background. The disadvantage is that there is still a lot of time until he finishes his studies. His dream is to be a professional, so he can have a good job, and he wants to buy utensilts and kitchen supplies, such as: eating utensils, knives, pots, pans, dust covers, etc. This is his first sequence of loans with the institution in the one year he has been doing this study.
It is for these reasons that Jose asks for a loan, to purchase utensils and kitchen supplies to continue and finish his professional career.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and kitchen supplies to continue and finish his professional degree.

loans.name: Hermitaña

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SANTA CATALINA DE SILLACANCHA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Hermitaña tiene 50 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, la socia dese poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the SANTA CATALINA DE SILLACANCHA communal bank. The bank is located in the Calca district of the Calca province, in the department of Cusco.

The member, Hermitaña, is 50 years old, and makes a living in agriculture, alternating between different tasks daily. She is a responsible person and has worked a long time in this business, which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She hopes to be able to keep working in order to continue supporting her family.

The member is applying for this loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is thankful for the loan granted and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: 031201010004.thị Trấn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ước has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

Ước is 28 years old and she is married.  She has two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 031201010004.Thị Trấn solidarity group. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Ước joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ước has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Ước has been involved in this business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ước hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Mary Paz

texts.en:
Mary Paz is 57 years old and single.  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Paz requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her piglets.

Mary Paz has been in this business for 10 years now.  She also earns additional income from farming rice and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her piglets

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Un, 46 years old, joined the program of M7-MFI in the first stage of its establishment. She is always enthusiastic to help other women who are facing difficulties in their lives. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.
	
Her family’s main income is mostly from cultivation and animal breeding. The annual income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the family’s living expense and keep a little amount as a saving. She wants to buy fertilizer for the coming crop but the saved amount is not enough. Recently, people are in the habit of using chemical fertilizer for planting trees, so the land is becoming infertile leading to the low productivity. So, this year, she and her husband have decided to change and buy organic fertilizer for the trees, although the cost is doubly expensive as compared to chemical fertilizer. The saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for sugar cane and rice. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy organic fertilizer for these kinds of trees. 
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that change of using fertilizer from chemical fertilizer to organic fertilizer will help her family invest effectively with high productivity to double the last year"s.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.  She runs a personal products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of personal products to offer for sale.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store business. Ednalyn dreams that one day, she will be able to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal products

loans.name: Nhuong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhuong, the Kinh ethnic majority woman, has joined the program of M7-MFI in January 2010. She lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.
	
Her family’s main income is from her husband’s meager retired salary. She has to spend the salary very economically in order to have enough money to cover the living expense of the whole family. She wants to raise chickens and sows to get more income for the family, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she needs to borrow a loan to invest in raising sows and chickens.
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding model. Next year, when selling the pigs and chickens, it will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to invest in raising sows and chickens

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, born in 1985, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been in the program of M7-MFI since January 2011. She is a young active member, always strictly complying with the institution’s regulations and helping other members when they are facing difficulties. She lives with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
	
Her family life is based on cultivation and animal breeding. Her family has only 0.6 hectare of coffee fields, so the income from coffee is just enough to buy food and save a little amount. She wants to invest in raising sows to get more income, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in breeding.
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI, and is hoping that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively, and that it will bring her family some breeding pigs.  That should gain a considerable profit.

loans.use: to invest in breeding

loans.name: Majorie Claire

texts.en:
Majorie Claire is 41 years old.  She is married and has two children who are presently in school.  Majorie Claire works very hard to provide for them.

Majorie Claire runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, soft-drinks, spices and other personal care products.

Majorie Claire has been in this business for 14 years.  She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items of groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, soft-drinks, spices and other personal care products

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera, tiene una bebé de un año, y su negocio es la elaboración de pasteles, masitas y empanadas. 
Ella es buena madre, amigable, feliz, emprendedora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘vino tinto’ dónde los pobladores son trabajadores fabriles que se asentaron cerca de las fábricas dónde trabajaban. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados.
María es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lo usa suelto, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su bebé que ya camina, viven en un cuarto en casa de sus padres construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la panadería, y se especializa en la elaboración de pasteles, masitas y empanadas. Actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada para el horneado, la venta la realiza desde después de hornear hasta finalizada la tarde. “inicié mi actividad hace 10 años, elaborando masitas y repartiéndolas a los negocios cercanos, ahora cuento con mi propia tienda dónde vendo mis ricas masitas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es independiente y constante, la desventaja es que como madre soltera debe cuidar a su hija y trabajar. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, ella desea renovar sus materiales de trabajo, sus utensilios de cocina para mejorar su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que María solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina para mejorar su panadería y darle una vida mejor a su pequeña bebé.
texts.en:
María is a 34 year old woman, is single, and has a one year old baby.  She has a business making cakes, pastries, and empanadas.  She is a good mother, is friendly, happy, enterprising, responsible and very hard-working.  

Her business is located in the "vino tinto" (red wine) region where the people are factory workers who settled there to be close to the factories where they work.  The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that ranges between 4-16 degrees centigrade during the day.

María has a tan complexion, dark eyes, long hair she likes to wear loose, and is of medium build.  Her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for general use and in her business.  She shares her life with her baby who is already walking.  They live in a room in her parents home made of bricks and cement, with a corrugated iron roof.  The house has running water, electricity, and a sewer connection.

Her business is a bakery, and she specializes in making cakes, pastries, and empanadas.  She performs this work every day of the week during the very early hours of the morning.  She later sells them in the afternoon.  She comments: "I began my work 10 years ago, making pastries and distributing them to the nearby businesses, now I have my own store where I sell delicious pastries".  The advantage of her business is that it is independent and stable, the disadvantage is that as a single mother she must care for her daughter and work.  Her dream is to expand her business to give her daughter a better quality of life.  

She wishes to replace her work materials, her cooking utensils, in order to improve her business.  This is the second sequence of loans with this institution in the 10 years she has been doing this work.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils to improve her bakery to give her baby a better quality of life.

loans.name: Ligia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Ligia Isabel de 41  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace mas de 20  años al negocio de venta de Rosquillas, Quesadillas, y Hojaldras,  Radica en la aldea  los Chorritos,  al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Ligia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos, Maíz, Queso, Manteca y Leña, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente existente  con deseos de seguir  trabajando  con Prisma y Kiva.
Doña Ligia su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - MARZO  2015.
texts.en:
Ligia is 41 years old, and lives with her husband and children in her own home. For more than 20 years she has had a business selling doughnuts, quesadillas, and puff pastries. She lives in the town of Los Chorritos in southern Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to get ahead and strives every day to improve her quality of life.

Ligia is requesting a loan to buy products such as corn, cheese, butter and firewood. With the help of this loan she intends to improve her income and also  her quality of life. She is an existing client with the desire to keep working with Prisma and Kiva. Ligia's dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele and at the same time improve her future with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, butter and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Caminemos Al Futuro  Ii Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS AL FUTURO II, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia María Antonieta continua con su negocio de ferretería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo clavos, cemento, vidones, pinturas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de clavos, pinturas, alambres  entre otros. 
Los demás socios se dedican a la ferretería, agencia de viajes, venta de chocolates y comida, internet. 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
María Antonieta belongs to the community bank CAMINEMOS AL FUTURO II. The bank is located in the administrative division of Cusco, in the province of Cusco.

María Antonieta is continuing with her hardware business. She is a responsible and earnest person. She continues to sell nails, cement, drums, and paintings etc. for all her customers. This helps her support her family.

María Antonieta requests a loan to buy nails, paint, wire and others. The other members make their living with the hardware store, travel agency, selling chocolates and food, and internet.

The members appreciate the opportunity and agree to meet the payment deadlines for the contributions. The members in the added pictures excused themselves for being late for the meeting due to work.

loans.use: to buy nails, paint, wire and others.

loans.name: 7 De Junio Palmareal Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  7 DE JUNIO PALMAREAL, el banco esta ubicado en la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Balbina tiene 43 años de edad  tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  de agricultura el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono para la agricultura.
Los socios  se sienten agradecidos  por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the 7 DE JUNIO PALMAREAL [June 7th Royal Palm] community bank. The bank is located in the La Convención province, in the department of Cusco.

The member Balvina is 43 years old, has 2 children, and is single. She alternates her daily activities, making her living in agriculture. The member has had her agricultural business for a good while, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it everyday. At the same time, she makes a living raising small animals. The member would like to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is applying for the loan to buy seeds and compost.

The members are grateful for the loan and are committed to making their payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Bievenido En El Nombre De Jesus Group

texts.en:
The Bienvenido en Nombre de Jesús communal bank is comprised of three hard-working women who struggle for the well-being of their families.  

Lucila, age 32, is married and has three children.  She sells clothes.  She also sells soup on Sundays.  She is requesting a loan to buy blouses, skirts, pants, and shoes.

The second member is Norma, age 20.  She makes pastries.

Mercedes, age 65, sells soup and food.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, and shoes.

loans.name: Nikki

texts.en:
Nikki sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enriched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and supplies and pay for the maintenance of her computer units. The loan also helped her provide for the family's daily needs and expenditures.

Nikk is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, very positive that she can improve even more her Piso Net business. This loan will go toward the purchase of supplies she needs in her shop and additional Piso Net units she needs to improve her service and profit. The increased income will help her to better meet the needs of her family.

Nikki dreams of giving her family a better and sustainable livelihood, and hopes for her children to finish their schooling. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for an additional Piso Net unit.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 39-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines for the past 12 years. 

A recipient of three past loans from NWTF, Rosemarie has requested a new one for PHP 8000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 56 años de edad es casado tiene una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 12 y 23 años de edad, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Francisco con el objetivo de generar sus ingresos se dedica  al cultivo de papa, desde hace 20 años, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos también tiene una pequeña tienda en la ciudad, gracias  a estas dos actividades ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Francisco ahora se ve a la necesidad de acudir a un crédito para poder  cultivar en esta temporada,  pues ya se acerca la época y él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar sus semillas de papas y fertilizantes. Él tiene las esperanzas  de conseguir el crédito para poder cultivar este año para mejorar sus ingresos y construir más casas para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 56-year-old man who is married and has a beautiful family that includes seven children between the ages 12 and 23. He and his family live in the community of Sololá.

Francisco has been cultivating potatoes for the past 20 years in order to generate income. However, in order to improve his earnings, he also manages a small store in the city. Thanks to these two businesses, he has been able to help his children get ahead.

Francisco now needs to acquire a loan so that he can proceed with cultivating the crops for this season. As planting season approaches, he does not have enough money to buy potato seedlings and fertilizers. He is hopeful about securing a loan so that he can cultivate a crop for this year so that he can improve his earnings and build more homes for his family.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Manuel Arturo

texts.en:
