Manuel Arturo lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is employed of the ENEE since 4 1/2 years ago, and he wishes to engage in animal husbandry, in the next few years. Age 46 years; He is married and has three children. It is clear that Manuel Arturo works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes to improve his living conditions with the new solar energy system.
Manuel Arturo is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will allow him to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and save in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 39 years old, married and has two daughters. She sells toys and gifts in a Mexico City market. She has been working in retail for more than 20 years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more inventory for the coming season. She says that her biggest accomplishment has been supporting her husband and providing stability for her daughters. She hopes to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as toys and gifts for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina, a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child, runs a general store in the Philippines. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Edwina has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items including biscuits, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as biscuits, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hien, born in 1979, is a Thai ethnic woman. Currently living with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province, she has been in the program of M7-MFI since January 2011. 

Hien's family’s main occupations are coffee cultivation and animal breeding. Each coffee harvest they can earn an income of between VND 55 million and 60 million, but it is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and enable them to save a modest amount after deducting all costs. 

Hien wants to expand her pig-raising enterprise and is therefore requesting a loan to buy breeding pigs and food for them. She expects the loan will help her family invest effectively in breeding to achieve high productivity, resulting in a considerable profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs and food for them

loans.name: Milenka Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Milenka Teresa pertenece al banco comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO.
La socia sigue dedicándose a trabajar para una empresa privada, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua trabajando para esa empresa el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de bienes de consumo entre otros.
texts.en: The member Milenka Teresa belongs to the Maria Elena Moyano communal bank. She is still working at a private company; she is a responsible and hardworking person. She is still working for the same company, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. This is how she is getting her family ahead. She is asking for the loan to buy consumer goods, among other items.

loans.use: to buy consumer goods, among other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, block, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang, 34 years old, has participated in the program of M7-MFI since January 2010. She lives with her husband and her two lovely daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her elder daughter is in primary school, and her younger daughter is in kindergarten. They are both obedient and clever.

Her family’s main income is her and her husband’s meager civil servant salaries. They have had to spend very economically in order to have enough money to cover the living expenses of the whole family and to save a small amount. However, the saved amount is not enough for them to pay for their children’s education fees. Therefore, she needs to borrow a loan to invest in her children’s education.
 
She hopes the loan amount will help her children have good conditions for learning, and that they will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education

loans.name: Cristian Camilo

texts.es:
Cristian, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, inicio con un negocio de barbería prestando su servicio en su casa o a domicilio en el municipio de Medellín, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

El trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupado en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitado por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de sillas profesionales, tocador, espejo, maquinas de motilar, entre otros.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Cristian a continuar con su proyecto de vida!¡
texts.en: In his tireless search for a better life and financial stability, Cristian started a barber shop business, rendering services in his house and at his customers' houses in the Municipality of Medellin, a municipality where resolution and bravery are important characteristics of the inhabitants of this area. He works different schedules every day, and he is always busy with some service, given that he is in high demand because of his good work. He is requesting a financial boost to buy professional chairs, a dresser, a mirror, hair clippers, among other things. Nowadays, he feels happy for the good job he has done so far and that has allowed him to have a more stable job. With a loan you will be able to support Cristian continue with his life project!

loans.use: to buy professional chairs, a dresser, a mirror, hair clippers, among other things.

loans.name: Jose Arnoldo

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de José es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
El prepara y vende comidas fritas en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposa e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Trabaja solo durante 7 horas todos los días.
El espera poder impulsar su negocio con la reparación y mantenimiento de su carro de comidas y con la compra de insumos y materia prima, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.

Con estos elementos él podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en: Thanks to Jose's perseverance and courage, his family is able to have a worthy life. He prepares and sells fried food at the Municipality of Medellin, a job he learned motivated to find new income to support his family. His wife and children are his main motivation for working every day and struggle to be better. He only works 7 hours every day. He hopes to boost his business by repairing and maintaining his food cart and by buying inputs and raw material. This boost can be given by "Corporacion Interactuar" and the Kiva lenders. With these elements, he will be able to have his food available for his customers at all times. His biggest dream is to be able to have a restaurant in the same area so he does not lose his customers.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his food cart, and to buy inputs and raw material.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como arepas, tamales y comidas regionales.
Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es el alto costo de los insumos, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Ana solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra surtido de ingredientes como maíz, carne, queso, entre otros para tener una mejor producción de alimentos y mejorar sus ventas.

Con tu ayuda Ana Podrá pagar la educación de sus hijos que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Ana is a very enterprising, tenacious woman with big dreams that she has been nurturing and trying to achieve.

She has a small business where she prepares and sells food, such as arepas (corn tortillas), tamales, and regional dishes.

With this work, she attempts to get ahead in life and improve the living conditions of her family, which consists of her husband and her four children. They are her driving force in life and her motivation for the daily struggle.

Her greatest difficulty is the high cost of supplies, but she is able to support herself and progress thanks to her great working capacity.

Ana is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients, such as corn, meat, and cheese, so she can produce more food and increase her sales.

With your help, Ana will be able to pay for her children’s education; this is one of her greatest dreams!

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as corn, meat, and cheese

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Isabel, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su familia.

Ella decidió por iniciar con un negocio de preparación y venta de arepas y alimentos a base de maíz desde hace aproximadamente 21 años en su casa con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, con la necesidad y el gusto por la cocina, esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio con la ayuda de los prestadores de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar insumos para sus preparaciones como maíz y queso.

Con este crédito podrá sostener su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada día más.
Es una mujer que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
This is Isabel, she is a woman of character and goodwill, with the desire to succeed and get ahead with her family. 
She decided to open a business preparing and selling arepas (corn cakes) and other corn based products approximately 21 years ago in her home, with a lot of effort and enthusiasm.
She learned this occupation by trial and error, driven by necessity and a love of the kitchen, and this allowed her to obtain a lot of experience. 
Today, she wants to give a small push to her business with the help of Kiva lenders and Interactuar Corporation. For this reason, she requires a loan to purchase ingredients for her meals, such as corn and cheese. 
With this loan she will be able to keep her business going and make it grow every day.
She is a woman who takes on challenges and faces them with bravery.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for meals, such as corn and cheese.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es:
Gerardo, se dedica a la albañilería en su tiempo libre y tiene un empleo como auxiliar en una vidriera, su padre le enseño a desarrollar las actividades de albañilería y también a elaborar estructuras metálicas, poco a poco ha adquirido más experiencia, posteriormente decidió buscar empleo y lo encontró como ayudante en una vidriera, en donde tiene dos años de laborar; Gerardo vive con su compañera de vida.
Invertirá en palas, niveladores, cucharas, ladrillos, arena, cemento, etc., renovara parte de su equipo de albañilería y reparará su vivienda, busca mejorar la calidad en sus trabajos y tener una vivienda más presentable.
Sus aspiraciones son tener su propio negocio, reducir sus deudas, construir por completo su vivienda y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Gerardo works in construction in his free time, and he has a job as an assistant in a glass making shop. His father taught him how to carry out the activities related to construction, and also to make metal structures.  Little by little, he acquired experience. Later, he decided to look for employment, and he found it as an assistant in a glass making shop, where he has been working for two years. Gerardo lives with his life companion.

He will invest in shovels, levels, trowels, bricks, sand, cement, etc.  He will update part of his construction equipment and he will repair his house. He wants to improve the quality of his work, and have a more presentable house.

His aspirations are to have his own business, reduce his debt, construct his house completely, and move forward with his family.

loans.use: to invest in shovels, levels, trowels, sand, cement, etc.; to update part of his construction equipment; and repair his house.

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es:
José, continua trabajando en el campo con la ayuda de préstamos, manifiesta que actualmente sus ingresos le alcanzan para ir cubriendo las necesidades familiares y cancelar su deuda.
Su negocio prácticamente es de subsistencia, por lo que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y herbicidas, tendrá a su alcance los materiales necesarios para sembrar maíz y preparar el terreno.
texts.en:
José continues working in the field with the help of the loans, and he states that currently, his income helps him to meet the needs of his family, and pay off his debt. 

His is almost a subsistence business, so he is requesting a new loan, in order to purchase compost, insecticide, and herbicide.  He will have the materials needed for planting corn and preparing the land available.

loans.use: to purchase compost, insecticide, and herbicide, and have the materials needed for planting corn and preparing the land.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help toward her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 25,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria aims to have business expansion so she will be able to help others who are in need. She hopes that her family will have good health and longer lives. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help toward paying for her child’s education, and her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 20,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Grace hopes to grow her business. She also dreams for her child to finish school for a better future ahead. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than seven years, and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her four children. She had to work hard together with Gerlito, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Letecia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With a loan of 30,000 PHP, she could then purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business. 

She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Letecia hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family through saving. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 62 years old and married with ten children.

Amparo works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF, in order to buy items like canned goods, noodles, soap, etc., to sell at her store.

Amparo has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years.

Amparo aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, noodles, and soap, to sell at her store.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 62 years old and married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Clara has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell at her store.

Clara has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell at her store.

loans.name: Rafael Andres

texts.es:
Rafael, un hombre de 50 años de edad lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Sahagún y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  

Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 4hijos.

Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 4 años con el fin de salir adelante y dejar de jornalear

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras y alimento.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado pues tendrá unos animales mejor alimentados.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Rafael!
texts.en:
Rafael is a 50-year-old man full of dreams and aspirations in life. He lives on a plantation in the Sahagún municipality, and makes a living raising and selling chickens and eggs. With this work he is trying to support his wife and four children. He has been working as a day laborer for the last 4 years in the hope of one day leaving it to work his way up in life.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy chickens, laying hens, and feed. It will enable him to have a stronger, more sustainable business since his animals will be better nourished. With this loan you will be improving Rafael's business and life!

loans.use: to buy chickens, laying hens, and feed.

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es:
Guillermo, un hombre de 45 años de edad que se encuentra muy motivado y emocionado ante la oportunidad que se le presenta en la vida y es que gracias a la Corporación Interactuar puede solicitar un préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, un sueño que le ha sido errado pues al ser su primera experiencia crediticia no le desembolsaban el préstamo. 

Con el crédito solicitado comprara un carro de comida, utensilios de cocina e insumos como harina, carnes frías, queso, salsas, entre otros. 

Este crédito será de suma importancia para Guillermo pues representa el principio de una vida como independiente y una oportunidad de progresar como empresario.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 45 years old. He is very motivated and excited for the opportunity that is being presented to him in life. Thanks to the Interactuar Corporation, he is able to request a loan to start his own fast food business, which so far has been an unfulfilled dream since during his first experience with credit, his loan was not paid out.

With the requested loan, Guillermo will buy a food cart, cooking utensils, and ingredients such as flour, cold cuts, cheese, sauces, and others.

This loan is of great importance to Guillermo since it represents the start of a life of independence and opportunity to grow as a business owner.

loans.use: to buy a food cart, cooking utensils, and ingredients such as flour, cold cuts, cheese, sauces, and others.

loans.name: Jull Hans

texts.es:
Jull, un joven de 18 años, vive en el municipio de La Dorada, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Este joven de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de comidas rápidas.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Jull podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que pagara sus estudios y aportara a los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de carro de comidas rápidas, instrumentos de cocina y en la compra de surtido e ingredientes para la preparación de sus alimentos.

Colabora a un joven emprendedor, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Jull is 18 years old. He lives in La Dorada municipality, a small city where there aren't many opportunities for progress and the competition for sales is really tough.
This young man is very clever and has high hopes to get ahead. His goal is to start a fast food business.

With the help of a loan, Jull will be able to fulfil his dream of becoming independent and earn his own income, which he will use to pay for his schooling and contribute to cover his home expenses.

This money will be invested to buy a fast food cart, cooking supplies and different ingredients for food preparation.

Please help a young man with a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart, cooking supplies and ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Enur Cecilia

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Enur desea montar un negocio de carnicería en un local ubicado en el municipio de Planeta Rica.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le dan sus 4 hijos, lo que la impulsa para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Aunque ella siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de carne al por mayor para poder iniciar.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
With hopes to get ahead and improve her life, Enur wants to set up a butcher shop at a building located in the Planeta Rica municipality.

She came up with the idea thanks to the motivation she gets from her 4 children, which triggered get to start this business, so she can generate an income to help her household. Although she's always wanted to become independent, she had never had the courage to take the rist and start a business; but she feels she is strong enough and capable enough to do it now.

She is asking for this loan to buy different cuts of meat wholesale to open her doors.

With these tools she will be able to start up this project and fulfill her dream of becoming independent.

With this project you will be supporting the ideas of a hard working Colombian mother!

loans.use: to buy different cuts of meat wholesale to start her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita finds pleasure in doing her vegetable gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. She busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of PMPC. She credits PMPC for her capital to support her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. In the future, Conchita wishes to become a supplier of vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own rug-making business for years and she earns well from this. Having more responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her grandchildren. She had to work hard with the determination of having better income, so she could improve their present living conditions.

To improve her profits, Remedios would like to apply for a new loan. With 40,000 PHP, she could purchase more quantities of raw materials, like fabric, thread and other materials, for her business. 

She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Remedios hopes to grow her business because she also wants to earn enough money to pay for the renovation of her house. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
A hardworking mother is what best describes Margie, 42 years old, residing in the SWP, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Margie has two children and is married to a carpenter. The wage that her husband earns isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs for their family. So, Margie started a business, a food stand or “carinderia.” Margie has been in the business more than a year now. 

Margie wants to expand her food stand business. She wants to gain more profits and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, and she would be able to send her son to college. In order for Margie to make her wishes possible, she needs a loan of 40,000 PHP and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things needed for the food stand. 

She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy rice toppings, meat, utensils and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, 69 years old, is widowed with seven children, and is a resident of SWP, Calamba, Philippines. Vegetable vending is her primary source of livelihood. She has been in this business for more than a decade. 

She became a member of Paglaum MPC in June of 2011. Recently, Regina decided to apply for a loan to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable vending business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to save more for the education of her grandchildren and for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enriched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and supplies, and pay for the maintenance of her computer units. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business even more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward paying for the supplies she needs in her shop and also to buy additional computer units she needs to improve her service and profits. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family with the help of this assistance.

Adelaida dreams to give her family a better and sustainable livelihood. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies needed for her business and to buy additional computer units.

loans.name: Dionafe

texts.en:
Dionafe has faithfully paid back her previous loan that she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years now and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with better education. 

To improve sales, Dionafe would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With 50,000 PHP, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Dionafe hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family through expanding her business and adding other inventory if possible. She wants to see her children finish school as well. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from her study of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to resell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
La venta de refrescos y comestibles, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Carlos, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio y a su familia.

El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 5 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días para ofrecer sus alimentos.
Trabaja solo todos los días durante 8 horas.

Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por este negocio.

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

El pide un auxilio económico con la Corporación Interactuar para comprar una un amplio surtido de frituras y refrescos, de esta manera abastecerá y venderá una mayor cantidad de alimentos.

Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilo y cómodamente sus alimentos.

Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en:
Carlos works selling food and drinks. He is very motivated and driven to see his business and family succeed.

He's worked in this field for more than 5 years. He begins his day very early in the morning to be able to offer his products. He works alone 8 hours a day, every day.

He decided to start this proyect out of the need to generate a larger income for his family; as he didn't have enough education for a different position, he chose this business.

He is very polite and amicable, always willing to help and cover the needs of his customers.

He is asking for financial help from Corporación Interactuar to buy a wide range of fried snacks and drinks for restock, so he can sell a larger variety of food.

His dream is to have his own store to he can be more comfortable selling his products.

Make a loan and hand your support today, take a chance!

loans.use: to buy a variety of fried snacks and drinks to restock and resell.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en:
Ang, 41 years old, is a married mother of five children. Four of them are dependents and only two among them are in school. Ang lives in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming, potato farming and working for another farm for 23 years. These jobs earn her about 44,000 KHR per day. 

Ang’s group consists of two members, and this is the fourth loan for her with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loan helped her to have better living conditions. 

As a group leader, she will use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She hopes that she could earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 40 years old and has six children, five of whom are in school. Judith is widowed.

Judith is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Judith requested a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Judith has been raising livestock for nine years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort grows organic and Fair Trade certified oil palms and lives in Akim-Abodom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 65 years old, widowed and has eight children. Some of her children are pursuing a post-secondary education. 

Comfort believes organic oil palm farming is profitable and environmentally sustainable. She wishes to secure a microloan in order to expand her organic oil palm field. The extra income will allow how her to support her children’s continuing education.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field

loans.name: Sann's Group

texts.en:
Sann, 33, lives in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of two dependent children and they are in school. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and working for other farms for fifteen years. She earns around 37,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 

Sann’s group consists of three members, and this is the fourth loan for her with VisionFund. The previous loans helped her to earn more income and to send her children to school. Now she is leading the group to apply for the loan with a portion to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that she can earn more income to renovate her house and to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is an oil palm farmer and retired teacher who lives in Akim-Abodom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 51 years old and married with 8 children. Three of his children are in primary school, three are in senior high school, and two have completed post-secondary education. 

Paul's farm is organic and Fair Trade certified, and he sells his palm fruits to Serendipalm, which in turn supports the community with infrastructural Fair Trade projects. He wants to secure a loan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. The additional income will allow him to improve his family’s standard of living and fulfill his hope to continue funding his children's education.

loans.use: Expansion of Oil Palm Field

loans.name: Jaidy Antonio

texts.es:
Jaidy con 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de 1 hijo de 7 años. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Hace 3, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comercialización de cerdos, pues los compra, los cría, engorda y posteriormente los vende según el peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de su hijo. 

El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito con la Corporación Interactuar, para invertirlo en la compra de alimento y concentrado para sus cerdos, así podrá tener unos animales mejor alimentados y podrá venderlos a mejor precio. 

De esta manera, Jaidy espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de sus sueños, que son aumentar sus ventas, comprar vivienda propia y lograr una estabilidad económica para darle a su familia la oportunidad de tener buenas condiciones de vida.

Mejora la vida de este colombiano con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Jaidy is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and a his 7 year old son. During his working life, he's done a variety of free lance activities, which have allowed him to support his family. 

3 years ago, he began commercializing pigs. He raises them, fattens them, and later on sales them for a price based on the animal's weight. This allows him to have enough resourses to support and care for his son. 

He is a fighter, working hard to get ahead, motivated by his family. For this reason, he applied for a loan from Corporación Interactuar, to invest in pig feed, to have better fed animals that can be sold for a better price. 

Thus, Jaidy hopes to take another step towards fulfilling his dreams of increasing sales, buying a home and achieving financial stability so he can give his family the chance to have better living conditions.

You can improve the life of this Colombian man by making a loan!

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Viviana montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo. 

La actividad la aprendió de manera empírica y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 

Con sus trabajos, Viviana ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Viviana busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos como tela, hilos, agujas, botones, entre otros.

Viviana espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 

Además, Viviana espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
With very little money, Viviana set up her tailor shop with the goal of generating an income to cover her household expenses. She lives with her 2 children and her husband. 

She learned his activity by trade and she has been able to work on projects charaterized by her great quality and speedy delivery. 

Thanks to these projects, Viviana has been able to retain a large amount of clients that generate and guarantee great monthly sales, so she hopes her business will continue to grow, so she can, in the future, create jobs for people in need of work. 

In order to cover her clients' needs, Viviana is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, buttons and others. 

Viviana is hoping that, this way, her family will be able to enjoy her larger income, which will allow them to have a better quality of life and a better education. 

Also, Viviana hopes that, if her business grows at a  good pace, it will be able to create at least one job position for someone who is interested in the trade and is unable to find work.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, buttons and others.

loans.name: Samuel Kofi

texts.en:
Samuel has an organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farm located in Akim-Abodom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 33 years old and married with two children, who are both in primary school. Samuel believes organic oil palm farming is profitable and helps protect the environment. 

The organic palm oil is sold to Serendipalm, which in turn supports the community through a Fair Trade Fund. He wants to secure a microloan to expand his Oil Palm field, allowing him to continue funding his children’s education and improve his family’s standard of living. More Fair Trade & Organic Palm Oil sold by Serendipalm will also contribute to more community development projects.

loans.use: Expansion of Oil Palm Field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his organic palm oil field

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
Adelaide is a fruit cleaner at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. She is 46 years old and divorced with two children. One child is in high school and the younger one is in primary school. 

Adelaide is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. She wants to secure a microloan so that she can expand her oil palm field, allowing her to fund her children's education and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand her oil palm field

loans.name: Sarpong

texts.en:
Sarpong grows organic and Fair Trade certified oil palms in Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 54 years old and married with 3 children. All of his children are still in school.
 
Sarpong wants to secure a loan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. With the additional income from selling organic oil palm fruit he plans to continue funding his children’s education and hopes to improve his family’s standard of living.

Sarpong believes in organic oil palm farming as a way to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
Kwadwo grows organic and Fair Trade certified oil palms in Ntronang near Akim Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 51 years old, divorced with four children, all of them still attending school.

He wishes to secure a microloan in order to expand his oil palm field. The additional income from selling more Fair Trade & organic oil palm fruits will be used to improve his family’s standard of living and pay for his children’s education. 

Kwadwo believes organic oil palm farming is environmentally sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is an organic oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 69 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in senior high school.

Joshua wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field with a hardier variety of oil palms. The extra income from selling Fair Trade & organic palm fruits will allow him to provide for his children and assist them in their educational goals.

Joshua believes organic oil palm farming is environmentally sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth grows organic and Fair Trade certified oil palms in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 60 years old and is married with 4 children. All of his children are still in school.
 
Seth wants to secure a loan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field. With the additional income from selling organic oil palm fruit he plans to continue funding his children’s education and hopes to improve his family’s standard of living.

Seth believes in organic oil palm farming as a way to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel grows organic and Fair Trade certified oil palms in Kukubi near Bomso, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. He is 60 years old and married with six children. All of his children are still in school.
 
Samuel wants to secure a loan so that he can expand his organic oil palm field with a more productive variety of oil palm. With the additional income from selling Fair Trade and organic palm fruits he plans to fund his children’s education, make necessary home improvements, and buy better farm equipment.

Samuel believes organic oil palm farming is environmentally sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural Fair Trade projects.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright is a production worker at Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified palm oil mill, and lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. He is 32 years old, single with a child. His child is not yet old enough to have started school.

Bright is interested in organic palm oil farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his palm oil field, allowing him to pay for his child's education and make necessary improvements on his home.

loans.use: to expand his organic palm oil field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a fruit cleaner for Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill in Akim-Asuom, located in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 48 years old and married with seven children. All of her children are attending school.

Doris is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through Fair Trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a microloan so that she can expand her organic oil palm field. This will help her fund her children’s education today while developing a property that will also yield fruit in years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field

texts.en:
Gladys is a fruit cleaner for Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill.  She also grows organic oil palms. She lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 37 years old and single with three children. All of her children attend primary school. 

Gladys is interested in organic oil palm farming, because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through Fair Trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a microloan so that she can expand her organic oil palm field. This will help her fund her children’s education today, while developing a property that will also yield fruit in years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field.

Hannah is interested in organic oil palm farming, because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through Fair Trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a microloan so that she can expand her organic oil palm field. This will help her fund her children’s education today, while developing a property that will also yield fruit in years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field

Grace is interested in organic oil palm farming, because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through Fair Trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. Foster is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wants to secure a microloan so that he can expand his oil palm field, allowing him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a fruit cleaner for Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and she also grows organic oil palms. She lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 35 years old and married with five children. All her children are in school. 

Irene is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through fair-trade projects for health, education and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a microloan so that she can expand her organic oil palm field. This will help her fund her children’s education today while developing a property that will also yield fruit in years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Laurencia is 59 years old, and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, soft drinks, curls, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Laurencia has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store like canned goods, soft drinks, curls, etc.

loans.name: Nicolas De Jesus

texts.es:
Nicolas es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de yuca el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Marinilla.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de yuca y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.

 Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores de Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en: Nicolas is a veteran with a lot of experience in the field. He is humble and simple.  He is very friendly with people, and has great energy to develop any crop that needs production. He has a cassava field, which he works daily to sell his products in the market square of the municipality of Marinilla. Thanks to his years of experience and teachings received from his father since he was a child, he is able to work and to advice other farmers in the area who need help with their production. He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, cassava seeds, and pesticides. This way, he will inject capital to his business and will improve his crops in a significant manner,  facing the most difficult obstacle they have, which is the ever-changing climate that affects their crops.He has a lot of faith in his business, and great hope in the helpful people who support the working farmers of Colombia such as Corporacion Interactuar. Support a humble farmer so that he can get develop his fields with a loan!

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, cassava seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children who are presently in school, Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, milk, coffee, soft drinks and other personal care products.

Rosemarie has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, milk, coffee, soft drinks and other personal care products.

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Phoeun, 42, is a resident in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is a widowed mother of one child who still depends on her. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming, which she has been doing for 24 years. As a factory worker, she has an additional source of income. She can earn about 36,000 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan cycle with VisinFund for Phoeun's group which consists of two members. The past loans helped her to renovate her house. As a leader, she applied for this loan to use her portion to buy fertilizer for the farm. She hopes that she could earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Geisel Maria

texts.es:
Geisel tiene más de 9 años de haber iniciado una pulpería en su hogar, negocio que con el tiempo ha ido prosperando y ampliándose, ya sea en infraestructura y en clientes. Ella se apoya de los ingresos económicos de su esposo para poder abastecerla y así, poder aumentar las ganancias. 
Sin embargo, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, papel higiénico, salsa de tomate, jabones, golosinas, gaseosas, además de la adquisición de nuevos artículos. Lo que le servirá para ofrecer mayor variedad, a la vez, podrá aumentar sus ingresos. Entre los planes de Geisel esta poder ampliar su negocio y a corto plazo convertirse en una distribuidora.
texts.en: Geisel has been running a general store from her home for over 9 years. In that time the business has prospered and expanded, in terms of both infrastructure and customers. Geisel uses the support of her husband's income to stock the store and thereby increase its earnings. However, she is requesting a loan to buy grains, toilet paper, tomato sauce, soaps, candy, soda, and other new items. This will allow her to offer greater variety, and at the same time increase her income. Geisel plans to grow her business, and in a short time convert it into a distribution business.

loans.use: to buy grains, toilet paper, tomato sauce, soaps, candy, soda, and other new items.

loans.name: Leynis Patricia

texts.es:
Leynis, radicada zona rural del municipio de Lorica, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 

Lleva unos 11 años con su propia cría de cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con mejorar su negocio y solicitó a la Corporación Interactuar un crédito con el que podrá realizar adecuaciones a sus marraneras y comprara alimento para cuidar a sus cerdos.

Las ganancias obtenidas será mucho mayor ya que tendrá unos cerdos en mejores condiciones sanitarias y mejor alimentados, lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.

De este negocio dependen sus 3 hijos a quienes intenta sacar adelante día a día.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Leynis lives in a rural zone in the municipality of Lorica. She has always worked in the agricultural sector, along with her family who learned this trade. For the past 11 years she has had her own pig farm, where she grows pigs for fattening, sale, and distribution in various areas of her town. She dreams with improving her business and has asked for a loan from Corporacion Interactuar. With this credit, she will be able to make improvements to her pig corral and will buy food to take care of her pigs. The profits to be obtained will be greater, since she will have pigs living in better sanitary conditions, and better fed. Thus, it will allow her to have a better quality of life without so many economic difficulties. Her 3 children who she tries to support day by day, also depend of this business, Her biggest dream is to have her own house and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To make repairs to her pig corrals, and buy food to take care of her pigs.

loans.name: Aholou

texts.fr: Âgé de 47 ans, Aholou est propriétaire d’une boutique. Il y revend des produits alimentaires. Toujours célibataire et sans enfant, il habite dans la ville de Lomé. Aholou mène cette activité depuis 2ans et pour faire ses approvisionnements, il sollicite un second apport financier de de WAGES. Ainsi ce prêt lui permettra de s’acquérir d’autres produits alimentaires. Aholou a toujours rêvé d’avoir une boutique plus grande et espère qu’avec les revenus qu’il se fait de son commerce il y arrivera. Aholou prévoit dans un avenir proche se marier et avoir des enfants.
texts.en:
47-year-old Aholou owns a shop in which he resells food products. Still single without children, he lives in the city of Lome.

Aholou has been leading this activity for the past two years. He is seeking a second financial contribution from WAGES so he can resupply. This loan will thus enable him to acquire other food products.

Aholou has always dreamed of owning a larger shop and hopes that the income generated from his commerce will make it happen. Aholou expects that in the near future he will marry and have children.

loans.use: buy general food products

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Evelio, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio y a su familia.

El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 30 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días para ofrecer sus alimentos junto con su esposa (Ver Foto).
Trabaja todos los días durante 13 horas.
Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.
El pide un auxilio económico con la Corporación Interactuar para comprar una un amplio surtido de verduras y frutas de esta manera abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad de alimentos.

Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilo y cómodamente sus alimentos.
Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en: Evelio works as a fruit and vegetable street vendor. He is a man with inner strength and perseverance to carry forward his own business and his family. He has worked in this business for over 30 years working every day since very early in the morning to offer his products with his wife (see picture.) He works every day for 13 hours. He decided to start this project when he had the need to get more income for his family. Since he didn't have enough education for another job, he opted to sell fruits and vegetables. He is a nice and helpful man, always willing to fulfill the needs and desires of his clients.   He is requesting financial assistance from Corporacion Interactuar to make the purchase of a wide variety of fruits and vegetables, and thus have a large inventory to offer his customers and sell a larger quantity of products. His dream is to have a store where he can sell his products in a tranquil and comfortable manner. Lend and support today, get inspired!

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of vegetable and fruits and thus have a large inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy ingredients for food preparations

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and supplies, and pay for the maintenance of her computer units. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 60,000 PHP. This new loan will go to supplies she needs in her shop and also to buy additional computer units she needs to improve her service and profit. She will also pay for the maintenance of her shop. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Letecia hopes to grow and expand soon. She desires to have a better life and a stable source of income to support the needs of her family. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy an additional PC and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy ingredients for food preparations

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en: Emeliana has always had enthusiasm for her farming activities, from which she earns an income to support their family, in addition to her husband. At the age of 57 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to buy bags of fertilizer and pay for the labor cost in land preparation. In the future, Emeliana wishes to expand her business to benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and pay for the labor cost in land preparation.

loans.name: Isaac Group

texts.fr: Lushombo est une commerçante, vice présidente d’un groupe de crédits «Isaac», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 48 ans, veuve, mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse divers habillement dans un magasin de la  ville depuis 16 ans. Elle débuta son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle va acheter  des jupes, blouses, vestes, pantalons, chemises, sous vêtements, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Lushombo is a merchant, vice president of the "Isaac" loan group, and client of the Hekima MFI. She is a 48-year-old widowed mother of six children who all attend (or have attended) school.

For the past sixteen years she has been selling a variety of clothing from a store in the city. She started her business with funds received from her husband while he was still living.

She will buy skirts, blouses, jackets, pants, shirts, underwear, etc. This way she wants to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.

She thanks Hekima for the support given to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: Buy skirts, blouses, jackets, pants, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Rosita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional wood, bamboo, nails, strings, varnish and materials for her business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional wood, bamboo, nails, strings, varnish and materials for her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Cristina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Norma is 62 years old and has two children who are in school.

Norma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Norma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
Mab, 45, is a resident in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of six children; five of them are dependent children and only two are in school. The main source of her family’s income has been from rice farming for 25 years. To earn more income, she also works as a construction worker. She could earn around 36,000 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan cycle for her group, which consists of two members, with VisionFund. The previous loan helped her to have enough ability to renovate her house. Now she decided to take this loan, and with her portion, she will buy fertilizer for her farming. She hopes that she could earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Huyên

texts.en:
Huyên is 54 years old and she is married with four children. She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2014, Huyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Huyên faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Huyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 6 Thôn 5 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt works in agriculture raising livestock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Nguyệt is 43 years old and married with three children. 


In 2014, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of Nhóm 6 Thôn 5 Quảng Lưu Group. Nguyệt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nguyệt faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is 29 years old, married and has two children. 

Leonie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Leonie has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Leonie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 49 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cecilia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Miradi Group

texts.fr: Lusombo est commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, membre de la banque communautaire «Miradi», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 26 ans, mère de 2 enfants qui sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une alimentation dans la ville. Elle va acheter des sacs de riz, sucres, huiles végétales, laits. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Lusombo is a merchant who supports her husband, is a member of the "Miradi" community bank, and a client of the Hekima MFI. She is a 26-year-old mother of two small children.

She started her business with funds received from her husband, and owns a grocery store in the city. She will buy bags of rice, sugar, vegetable oil, and milk.

She wants to obtain more credit loans, build a house, educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, sugar, vegetable oil, milk.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou, 42, is a resident of Cheung Prey district in Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of four dependent children and only one of them is in school. The main source of her family’s income has been from rice farming for 18 years and to provide better support for her family and to earn more income, she also works as a construction worker.  She can earn about 55,000 KHR per day. 

Chanthou has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid the loan. Now she is leading a group of four to apply for this loan and with her portion, she will buy fertilizer for her farming. She hopes that she can earn more money to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ona Mbali Group

texts.fr: Mbusa est une commerçante, présidente de la banque villageoise «Ona Mbali», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 47 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants  qui tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse divers pagnes dans un  marché de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va acheter 100 pièces de pagnes. Elle débuta avec le premier capital venu de son conjoint qui est chauffeur. Ainsi, elle souhaite augmenter ses activités, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Mbusa is a merchant, the president of the Ona Mbali "banc villageois" loan association, and client of the Hekima MFI. She is a  47-year-old married mother of eight children, all of whom attend (or attended) school.

For the past fifteen years she has been selling a variety of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) in one of the city's markets. She will buy 100 lengths of pagnes. The initial funding of her business came from her husband who is a driver.

So she wants to increase her activities, educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for the support given to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy 100 lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in a small village. She is married and has four children. She has done business for almost 13 years in agriculture. Each year, she plants onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cereal, etc. She also plants cotton on her land. Halima is a goal-oriented, active and kind person. She plants and sells fresh and clean agricultural products in the domestic market. She is planning to buy fertilizer to plant potatoes, tomatoes and onions in order to gain a good harvest. She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders for a loan to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thúy is 26 years old and married with 1 child. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province.

Thúy operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She has been involved in this business for 2 years.

The main hardship that Thúy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well. She also hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Maysaramo

texts.ru: Это женщина Майсарамо. Она разведена мужем, и имеет одного единственного сына. Майсарамо 36 лет. Она жительница района Восеъ. Она живет вместе мамой, папой и сыном. Майсарамо талантливая и целеустремленная женщина с большими планами на жизни.  Она дома занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. В швейном деле ей нравится ежедневный доход и общение с новыми клиентами. Она одна в семьи работает и зарабатывает, чтобы обеспечить семьи. Майсарамо хочет улучшить процесс работы и увеличить ежедневный доход. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. За счет кредит она купить швейные принадлежности.
texts.en: Maysaramo is divorced from her husband and she has one son.  She is 36 years old and lives in the Vose district of Tajikistan.  She lives with her mom, dad, and her son.  She is a skilled and ambitious woman who has big plans for her life.  She works from home, taking orders and sewing women's clothes.  She likes her activity for the daily income that it brings and for the contacts she makes with new customers.  She is the only breadwinner in the family.  Maysaramo wants to improve her work and increase her daily income.  For this reason, she is taking a loan and will use it to buy sewing supplies.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and improve her work.

loans.name: Mahatoky

texts.fr:
Mahatoky a 52 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants dont les 3 premiers ne sont plus à sa charge et le dernier est étudiant à l'université.
Achat et revente des fruits est l'activité génératrice de revenu de Mahatoky, il y est depuis 6 ans, et il est soutenu par sa femme dans l'exercice de cette activité. Son choix est les ananas et les papayes. Il pense que ce sont des fruits non saisonniers, existent durant l'année, seulement, c'est le prix qui n'est pas stable.
A part la vente au marché, il a des clients fixes qui sont la plupart des restaurateurs.
C'est un père de famille qui travaille infatigablement. On a pu constater son évolution et son effort: 
si auparavant, la famille n'arrivait qu'à louer  une maison en bois ordinaires pour l'habitation, actuellement, Mahatoky peut louer une maison en dur.
Il ne veut pas s'arrêter là, il projette d'épargner davantage pour soutenir les études de son dernier enfant, et pour sécuriser sa retraite et celle de sa femme.
texts.en:
Mahatoky is 52 years old, married with four children. The first three are no longer dependents and the last is a university student.

Buying and selling fruit has been Mahatoky's income-generating activity for the past six years, and he is assisted by his wife in this activity.

He chose [to sell] pineapples and papayas. He thinks that these are non-seasonal fruits, available year-round, and only the price is unstable. Apart from sales at the market, he has regular customers who are mostly caterers.

He is a family man who works tirelessly. One can notice how his efforts have improved his situation: if earlier the family could only rent a regular wooden house, Mahatoky currently rents a solid house.
