Elle souhaite, accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, construire une maison scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Rubavu has owned a bureau de change in the city centre for the past 10 years. This business belongs to the "La Révélation A" loan group, which is a client of IMF Hekima. He is a 28-year-old married father to three children, one of which is currently receiving an education while the other two are still too young to attend school. He started this business with funds he saved from working as a teacher. His partner is a shopkeeper. She will be charged with purchasing local currency. She hopes to be able to expand their turnover, build their own home and have their children well fed and educated. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase local currency

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.en:
Orzigul is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is living in the small village of Firdavsi where doing agriculture is the most common business. She is married and has three children. 

She heard that IMON provides training to entrepreneurs and decided to participate. She participated at a training called “Women Entrepreneur – Achieve Success” and wants to buy livestock and do business. 

She has good conditions to keep livestock at her house. She needs to do business because she is interested in keeping livestock and wants to have a farm in the future. Orzugul is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy livestock and start to do business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start to do business.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is single works hard to support her family. She operates a pig fattening business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from poultry.

Angeline requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Chhin's Group

texts.en:
Chhin, 45, lives in a rural area located in Chhloung district of Kratie province. She is a married mother of four independent children. The sources of her family’s income are from potato farming and rice farming for 25 years. She can earn about 50,000 KHR per day to support her family’s living. 

Her group consists of three members and this is the third loan for her with VisionFund. As leader of the group, she will use her portion to buy farming supplies to support her current business. She hopes that she can gain more return through her farming.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: enable her son to purchase smooth wooden boards and bamboos for sheltering services.

loans.name: Sri Ari

texts.en:
Sri has a family of three and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. 

In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Sri heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. 

Sri, who is also a health worker in her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area.
 
Sri will use this loan to buy about 20 filters and sell them to her neighbors on credit, making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighborhood with drinking water.

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.es:
Wenceslao vive con su cónyuge en la ciudad de Oyotún, una zona agrícola situada en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a la carpintería metálica, con una experiencia en el negocio de más de 35 años. Su negocio está localizado en su mismo domicilio. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de su familia. Wenceslao como ya tiene tiempo realizando la misma actividad conoce muy bien el negocio y por el buen trato que da cuenta con clientela fidelizada. El anhelo de Wenceslao es invertir en su mismo negocio, especialmente en la compra de materiales para su negocio como fierros, soldadura, y otros; de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida, es por ello que ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo para poder mejorar su negocio y la calidad de los servicios que brinda.
texts.en:
Wenceslao lives with his wife in the city of Oyotún, an agricultural area situated in the Oyotún district of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of the north coast of Perú. The residents of this district principally work in agriculture and raising livestock. He has more than 35 years of experience in the business of metalwork. His business is located in his home. He makes enough to support himself and his family. 

With the time he has spent in this type of work Wenceslao knows the business very well and because of his reputation for good treatment has a loyal customer base. Wenceslao's desire is to invest in his business, specifically in the purchase of iron, welding equipment, and other things. This way he will be able to improve his earnings and thus his quality of life. This is why he believes it's convenient to request a loan to be able to improve his business and the quality of services he offers.

loans.use: El préstamo será para la compra de materiales para su negocio como fierros, soldadura, y otros.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old, married, and has five children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling coconut wine. 

Rowena requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rowena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 35 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Glenda requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Glenda has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Glenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is 63 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Generosa operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 14 years. 

Generosa requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, milk, coffee, drinks, juice. and personal care products. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, milk, coffee, drinks, juice, and personal care products

loans.name: Perry

texts.en:
Perry is 44 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Perry is borrowing 5000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

Perry has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
The above picture presents Rosa. Rosa is a 49-year-old farmer from Koilot, a remote village in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience, despite personal challenges and her passion to support her four angel-like children as a primary caregiver. 

For the past 10 years, Rosa has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, poultry, tomatoes, and also keeping dairy cows. Rosa has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She is most passionate about farming. She takes pride in being a part of the fastest-growing a industry category in Kenya. 

Rosa is seeking a loan to invest in the expansion of her farm. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Rosa will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children a proper education. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. Help this wonder-woman realize her dreams!

loans.use: to buy more land to expand her farming

loans.name: Suyumkan

texts.ru: Суюмкан, 60 лет, замужем, многодетная мать 7 детей. Суюмкан, в качестве основного дохода уже 30 лет занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день у нее есть 6 коров, 2 лошади. Дети и супруг с радостью помогают по хозяйству. Суюмкан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 102,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита позволят Суюмкан улучшить благосостояние семьи и в дальнейшем развивать ее бизнес, чтобы накопить средства на отдых и лечение на курорте у берега озера.
texts.en: Suyumkan is 60 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. Suyumkan has reared animals for the last 30 years for her main income. She currently has six cows and two horses. Her children and husband gladly help her with the farmstead. Suyumkan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 102,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock to increase her herd. The income from the loan will allow Suyumkan to improve the well-being of her family and to develop her business in future in order to save money for rest and treatment at a lakeside resort.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Salimakan

texts.ru: Салимакан, 53 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Салимакан- высшее образование, работает в школе заведующей по учебной части. С 2000 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Салимакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 16 овец. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Салимакан до 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и дойных коров. Доходы от кредита помогут Салимакан развить ее бизнес и накопить средства на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Salimakan is 53 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Salimakan has a higher education and works as the Head of Studies of a school. She has been rearing animals since 2000. Thanks to her hard work, today Salimakan has four cows and 16 sheep on her farmstead. Salimakan's gross monthly income is up to 25,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farmstead, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and dairy cows. The income from the loan will help Salimakan to develop her business and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep and dairy cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more land and increase her farming

loans.name: Sabiran

texts.en:
Sabiran is a 40-year-old lady; she is the mother of two daughters and two sons. One of her sons owns a workshop in which he provides services to fix motorbikes; he is professional in his techniques and can easily fix motorbikes  in no time. He has to use various types of tools for repairing them. A few days ago he shifted his workshop to another place, and due to the move, some important and expensive tools have been misplaced.

Sabiran requested a loan for her son so that he would be able to compensate this loss. He will buy repair tools, spare parts, tyres, brake shoes, etc. for his motorbike  repair workshop. 

Sabiran wants to provide better education and living standards to her children. She is hopeful that her son will utilize this amount in positive way and his monthly income will increase. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase tools, spare parts, tyres, brake shoes, etc. for her son's motorbike repair shop.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat is a brave woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is living in a village with fresh and beautiful nature. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a constructor and works seasonally. She is busy in agriculture and has many years of practice. 

She is a bright, honest, hardworking and nice person. She is well-known as a brave and kind woman among friends and relatives. She works in order to earn money and help her husband to feed their family. 

She requests a loan to buy livestock. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness. The loan will help her to do her business well and feed her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rohila

texts.en:
Rohila is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She is living in small village with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a constructor. She is a tailor. She has many years of practice sewing traditional women's dresses. 

Rohila is a kind, bright, honest and hospitable person. For many years, she has attracted clients with her beautiful dresses and has permanent customers now. She gets orders from clients and sews according to their wishes. 

Her house is old; it was built many years ago, and Rohila and her family live there in bad conditions. She asked for a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to renovate her house. She hopes to be supported and believes that they will have better conditions in which to live.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Blecile

texts.en:
Blecile is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She is a hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. 

Blecile requested a loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Virgelia

texts.en:
Virgelia is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Virgelia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Virgelia requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Virgelia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virgelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Viviana Andrea

texts.es:
Viviana es una señora muy emprendedora, vive junto a sus dos hijas y su madre en la ciudad de Santo Domingo. Cuentan con casa propia en una vía principal de la ciudad, desde ahí Viviana por las mañanas se levanta a preparar unos delicioso cupcakes que los distribuye a panaderías del sector, ella aprendió de este arte a través del internet, comenta que le fascina la repostería y por ello hace más de un año decidió emprender en este negocio.
Le ha ido muy bien, gracias a estos ingresos puede darle la educación a su hija mayor, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de su hija, porque hace varios años se separaron. Viviana es una mujer luchadora, además del negocio de repostería, ella vende cosméticos para poder salir adelante, ha sido muy duro ser padre y madre para sus pequeñas, pero gracias a ellas puede tener fuerzas y seguir.
Viviana prepara estos ricos cupcakes manualmente, es un trabajo forzado, por lo que con este crédito va a comprar una batidora industrial necesaria para su trabajo diario. Está segura que su producción aumentará ya que es una herramienta básica para lo que hace, se siente satisfecha y feliz porque así podrá dedicarle más tiempo a su familia.
texts.en:
Viviana is a very enterprising lady. She lives with her two daughters and her mother in the city of Santo Domingo. They have their own house on a main thoroughfare in the city and Viviana gets up every morning there to prepare some delicious cupcakes to distribute to area bakeries. She learned this art through the Internet. She loves pastry and this is why she decided to learn this business.

It’s been going very well. Thanks to the income she can give an education to her oldest daughter who is not supported by her father since they were separated several years ago.

Viviana is a fighting woman. Besides the baking business she sells cosmetics in order to get ahead. It has been hard to be father and mother for her little ones, but it is thanks to them that she has the strength to carry on.

Viviana prepares these tasty cupcakes by hand. It is hard work which is why she will use this loan to buy an industrial mixer which is needed for her daily work and she is sure that her production will increase as it is a basic tool for doing it.

She is satisfied and happy because she will be able to spend more time with her family.

loans.use: to buy an industrial mixer for making cupcakes

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en:
Munaza is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband operates a business of providing and transporting construction supplies, such as sands, pebbles, concrete, cement, and soil, which he has been doing for many years. He is able to generate reasonable income for his family. 

Munaza's husband's trolley is broken due to overloading and bumps in the roads. He is does not have sufficient cash to fix the problem and to purchase new tires and is unable to continue his services. His earnings are zero. Therefore, Munaza requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to maintain the tractor and trolley and to purchase new tires. With the loan, he will be able to start his services again.

loans.use: to help her husband with the maintenance of his tractor and trolley and to purchase new tires

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado y es madre soltera de 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estudian y la mayor está casada.

Ana, es agricultora desde hace muchos años y además compra y vende productos en el mercado municipal.

Ana, ocupa el crédito para realizarle algunas reparaciones a su vivienda.

Ella sueña con ayudarles a sus hijos para que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old. She went to school through the fifth grade. She is a single mother of three children. Two of them are in school and the oldest is married.

Ana has been a farmer for many years. She also buys and sells products in the municipal market. 

Ana is seeking the loan to make some repairs on her home. 

She dreams of helping her children with their education so that they may become professionals.

loans.use: to make some repairs on her home.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 26-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Nandihills, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Rift Valley. She owns a small piece of land together with her lovely husband, and they have been blessed with two children. 

On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for five years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. 

From Kiva lenders, Joyce is seeking a loan worth KES 30,000 to buy more land to expand her farming. Most farmers in Kenya have small parcels of land and hence produce less. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Joyce access to a loan that will aid her to grow her farming into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Joyce’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to buy land to expand her farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his tuition for university and start to achieve his dreams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, a blower, nippers, curlers, a heating cup and other materials needed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to expand her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married and has children. She is from Cavite, Philippines.She has been employed in a garment factory in Cavite for two years through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Marites works as a sewer. She does the sewing and designing of clothing apparel according to the company or client’s demand. She sews clothes using sewing machine or other stitching machines. She also does hand stitching of edges and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Marites, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

Marites is requesting a loan to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is deducted every pay day.  She will also use the loan to redeem her ATM card that was pawned.

Marites hopes to provide her children with a quality education. She aims to improve their living condition. She meets with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to redeem her pawned ATM card

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

Imelda dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is 24 years old lives in Irbid. She is a single lady. She is studying for a degree in French language, and she is working really hard to get ahead and to grow.

Malak dreams of having a good job so that she could help to pay for her education and household expenses.

She is requesting an education loan to help her pay for her university fees because her parents could not cover her semester fees. Malak is a young lady who has dreams she wants to achieve, and she needs your support to help her access her goals.

loans.use: to cover her university fees because her parents could not cover her semester fees.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya, 41 years old, lives in Aqaba. She is a caring mother of seven children, and she is a conservative woman and asked her daughter to take her place in the photo. 

Haya, as all mothers, wants to see her children be successful persons in the future, so she is fighting all obstacles that she is facing to pay the education fees for her children who are in the university.

One of her children is Tasneem, who is studying in the university, majoring in accounting. Haya is dreaming of the day when her daughter will graduate and be a successful and productive woman; therefore, Haya asked for an educational loan to help her daughter pay her semester fees due to inability to pay her fees.

loans.use: to help her daughter pay her semester fees

loans.name: Suhail

texts.en:
Suhail is a 20-year-old single man. He lives with his family in Irbid. Since childhood, he has dreamed of becoming a professional banker, and because of that, he decided to study accounting in the university. 

Suhail is now in the second year, but the high cost of living and the cost of the studies of his brothers prevents his father from paying for his university fees. Suhail did not want to give up his dreams and stand in front of these obstacles doing nothing; therefore, Suhail requested a loan to help him pay for his university fees and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees and achieve his goals

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a 43-year-old married father of six children aged 17, 15, 13, 11, 9 and 7; five of these children are in school. He is a coffee trader from a busy street in Kitagata, Kakanju Mitooma District, Uganda. He is also an agriculturalist. He does not have any other children who live in his family, so his is a nuclear family. 

He works for 10 hours a day, and he started a tea farming business in 2004 to generate income for better living. 

This is his first loan from this institution, and he is borrowing 5,000,000 UGX to trade in coffee. His clients are wholesale coffee traders in Bushenyi District. He hopes to become the leading clean coffee trader in Bushenyi District. He is mostly affected by price fluctuations and high transport costs. He is a hardworking man. 

He thanks UGAFODE Limited and Kiva lenders for financing his business with loans and looks toward receiving more loans in the future to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Sokry's Group

texts.en:
Sokry, 46, lives in the Chhloung district of Kratie province. She is a divorced mother of two dependent children who are too young to get in school. The sources of her family’s income have been from smoking-tobacco farming and rice farming for 28 years. She could earn around 41,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Sokry’s group, which consists of four members, with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy more smoking tobacco for resale. She wants to earn more money and enough ability to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco for resale

loans.name: Lodger

texts.en:
Lodger is aged 26 years old and is borrowing a loan of UGX 5,000,000 shillings. He has never borrowed with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd.

He is a married man with three children, aged 7, 5, and 2 years old respectively. Two of them go to school. He works for twelve hours a day and six days a week, saving the last day for God at church.

He has another side income of agriculture. He started the retail shop business in 2002. He started this business to earn an income to support his growing family. This is his first loan from the institution, and he borrowed this money to buy more stock for the retail shop of daily household use items to sell to his customers.

He hopes the loan will help him increase his sales and profit. He dreams of expanding his shop into a wholesale business. Price fluctuations are his main challenges. He is a hardworking businessman. He asks the almighty to bless UGAFODE Microfinance and asks that it always be there for the needy but active people like him.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, rice, cooking fat, and beverages.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es una mujer de 57 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de chicharon de cerdo. 
Ella es comprensiva, buena oyente, atenta, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en ‘Tutimayu’ situada al noreste de la ciudad, el comercio se reparte en hoteles y restaurantes como; cafés, internet y tiendas generales. La oferta también se acerca a los deportes extremos, como rafting y parapente. De clima lluvioso y cálido con temperaturas de 18-35 grados centígrados. 
Evangelina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su anciana madre que apenas camina, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es la venta de chicharrón de cerdo; es una comida muy tradicional y característica de este lado de la ciudad. “cocino chicharrón, todos los condimentos y carne son muy frescos…” comenta. El lugar dónde vive es un área rural que no cuenta con servicios básicos, antes recogían agua con baldes del riachuelo, luego perforaron un pozo de donde extraen el agua, actualmente las empresas del servicio del agua llegaron al lugar y están realizando la conexión de agua potable. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de servicios básicos. Su sueño es contar con agua potable en su casa, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su madre deje de tomar agua sucia de pozo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Evangelina solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su madre deje de tomar agua sucia de pozo.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a 57-year-old woman. She is single and has no children. She has a business selling chicharrón (pork cracklings). 
She is empathetic, a good listener, courteous, responsible and very hard working. Her business is in Tutimayu in the northeastern part of the city. There are hotels, restaurants, internet cafes and general stores in the area. There are also nearby opportunities for extreme sport such as rafting and paragliding. The area has a rainy and warm climate with temperatures ranging between 18 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Evangelina is dark-skinned with long braided black hair. She has brown eyes and is short and slim. She wears traditional clothes: a hat, “pollera” [traditional skirt] and shawl. Her native tongue is Quechua which she speaks at home, and she also speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business. 

She shares her life with her aged mother, who can barely walk. They live in their own home. It is made of adobe and has a tin roof. The home has well water and electricity.

Her business is selling pork chicharrón (cracklings), a food that is typical and very characteristic of this region. She says that she cooks chicharrón with the freshest meat and condiments.

The home in which she lives is in a rural area and does not have basic services. They used to bring water from a stream using buckets. They later dug a well and get their water from it. Water services have now arrived in their area and are in the process of providing connections to access potable water. Her business has the advantage of dedicated customers, but the disadvantage of lack of access to basic services.

Her dream is to have potable water in her home. She would like to have water service to her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room so that her mother will not have to drink the dirty well water. This is her first loan cycle with this institution in the ten years that she has been in this business independently.

The reason that Evangelina is seeking a loan to get a water connection to her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room is so that her mother will not have to drink the dirty well water.

loans.use: to install a potable water connection to her kitchen, bathroom and laundry area so that her mother will not have to drink dirty well water.

loans.name: Piseth

texts.en:
Piseth is 22 years old. He is a single nursing student who is from a province in Cambodia. Currently, he is pursuing a bachelor’s degree in his second year at a university in the province. 

His parents earn income from pig fattening, rice farming and making Khmer noodles to sell. His father has a chainsaw, and he also cuts trees for payments. 

Piseth is short of the finances to pay his tuition fees from the second to the third year, so he would like to take out a loan. This loan will help him in earning the important skills for his future job. For his dreams after graduation, he hopes to run a small clinic and to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Mainor

texts.es: Minor tiene 28 años de edad, es casado, y vive con la esposa y tres hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos novillos. El quiere aumentar un poco la cantidad de animales, para tener más posibilidad de venderlos con un peso adecuado . Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mainor is 28 years old, married and lives with his wife and 3 children who are his first priority. He wants the loan to buy a few calves. He wants to increase the quantity of animals he has to have more possibility of selling them at an adequate weight. This is his first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from the State banks and FUDECOSUR is providing the loan with better conditions and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Los Chilamates Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los chilamates está conformado por 3 mujeres laboriosas coordinado por la señora Elena de 47 años, casada, madre de dos hijos, por los que trabaja día a día, para darles un futuro mejor. Su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio que la administra desde hace 4 años, con ayuda de su esposo quien le ayuda a despachar y realizar las compras, solicita por séptima vez el financiamiento de Adim, con el crédito anterior logro comprar un carrito de comida rápida, para aumentar sus ingresos, el nuevo crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, aceite, pollo, leche, gaseosa. La segunda socia es Flor de 33 años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y la tercer socia Eveling de 28 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
The Chilamates group is made up of 3 hardworking women and coordinated by Elena. Elena is 47 years old, married, and has two children for whom she works every day to provide a better future. She has a grocery store business in her home that she has run for the past 4 years. Her husband helps her to wait on customers and make purchases. 

She is requesting her seventh loan with Adim. With her previous loan, she purchased a fast food cart in order to increase her income. The new loan will be used to purchase rice, oil, chicken, milk, and sodas. 

The other members include Flor, who is 33 years old and sells cosmetics, and Eveling, who is 28 years old and sells secondhand clothing.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, chicken, milk, and soda.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
From GMA Cavite, Philippines, Emerita is married and has children. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Emerita works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as handstitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Emerita is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to moneylenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Emerita is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them, since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 10,000 PHP loan to pay for her pawned ATM card.

Emerita hopes to give her children good educations. She just wishes to meet their daily needs. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help.

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness, and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Emerita before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to redeem the ATM card that she pawned.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, de 59 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos, quienes le apoya en el trabajo del hogar.

Martha, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace varios años, tolo lo aprendio con sus padres, ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. junto a sus hijos para preparar lo que venderán en el almuerzo.- Ahora Martha, quiere iniciar con un nuevo negocio, de crianza y comercio de pollos de engorde, porque es un negocio muy rentable.

Martha, necesita el crédito para comprar pollos y comprar gallinas ponedoras, para iniciar la venta de huevos.

Martha, sueña ampliar su negocio y que la venta de huevos sea rentable.
texts.en:
Martha is 59 years old and attended school until the sixth grade. She is a single mother and has 6 children who help her with household work. Martha has made a living for the past several years by selling food. She learned the business from her parents. She wakes up at 5:00 am every day with her children in order to prepare the food that she will serve at lunch. 

Martha would like to start a new business raising and selling chickens because it is a very profitable business. She needs a loan to purchase chickens and laying hens in order to start selling eggs. Martha dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her egg sales business is profitable.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and laying hens.

loans.name: Aiperi

texts.ru: Айпери, 23 года, не замужем, детей нет. У нее высшее образование, работает кассиром, получая заработную плату в размере около 6,800 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на ремонт дома и улучшение жилищных условий ее семьи. Свою заработную плату она и дальше будет вкладывать в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Aiperi is 23 years old. She is unmarried and has no children. She has a higher education and works as a cashier, receiving wages of about 6,800 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to renovate her home and improve the living conditions of her family. She will also continue to invest her wages in renovating her home in future.

loans.use: to renovate her home in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Rosah

texts.en:
Rosah is 68 years old and has 11 children. She resides in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for 12 years on her small plot, where she does mixed farming. Rosah enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs. 

Rosah has a vision of owning a large cereal selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Rosah will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family. Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she would be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 59 years old and has three adult children, who are currently living in a rural community and making their living through farming. Due to financial hardship, Delia engages in cooking and selling snack foods like tupig (rice cake) and peanut butter within her community. She wants to continue and improve this business but she has limited capital. 

Delia is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy malagkit (rice), sugar, coconut, and peanut butter needed to cook. She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase malagkit (rice), sugar, coconut, and peanut butter

loans.name: Maripat

texts.ru: Марипат, 58 лет, замужем, многодетная мама 5 детей,самому младшему 20 лет. Образование у Марипат среднее, сейчас она на пенсии. Она очень ответственная, аккуратная и трудолюбивая, главной ценностью в жизни считает своих детей.Марипат 43 года назад начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет: 4 коровы 7 лошадей. Также Марипат выращивает ячмень на 1,0 ГА арендованной и 0,42 ГА собственной земли. Прибыль от бизнеса позволяет Марипат разводить скот и заготавливать для него корма на зиму. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 лошадей. Доходы от кредита Марипат планирует вложить в расширение хозяйства, постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en:
Maripat is 58 years old. She is married and the mother of five children, the youngest of whom is 20 years old. Maripat has a secondary education, and now she is retired. She is very responsible, neat and hard-working, and considers her children to be her main treasure. Maripat started farming 43 years ago. Today she has four cows and seven horses on her farmstead. Maripat also grows barley on 1.0 hectares of rented land and 0.42 hectares of her own land. The profit from the business allows Maripat to raise livestock and prepare feed for them for the winter.

In order to further develop her farmstead, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy two horses. Maripat plans to invest the income from the loan in expanding her farmstead and building barns for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy two horses in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Yuri Andrea

texts.es:
Yuri es una madre cabeza de familia, una guerrera y luchadora, se dedica a la venta de mercancía de productos de uso personal y gracias a esta actividad puede llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, donde la esperan siempre sus dos hijos un pequeño de 10 años de edad y una linda princesa de 6.

Su negocio lo inicio en el año 2010 como una alternativa para generar ingresos extras, tiene su vitrina ubicada en su hogar y gracias a este estilo de trabajo puede estar siempre pendiente de sus hijos, los deja en la escuela los recoge y puede vender durante la tarde y noche.

Este negocio para ella ha sido genial, sus condiciones de vida mejoran, ella es muy humilde y siempre recibe sugerencia y consejos con buena disposición, ahora que tiene experiencia, quiere invertir en su negocio para que este sea más lucrativo siguiendo un parámetro y sueño de montar un almacén propio.

Yuri quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de camisetas, camisetas, blue-jean, desodorantes, cremas de manos, accesorios (hebillas, chulos, esmaltes para uñas, diademas para cabello entre otros).

Este préstamo le permitirá tener mayor mercancía e ir incorporando nuevas cosas a su vitrina.
texts.en:
Yuri is a mother, the head of her household, and a determined woman. She makes a living by selling personal use products and, thanks to this business, she can provide for her household. She has a young, 10-year-old son and her daughter is a beautiful, 6-year-old princess. She started her business in 2010 as a way to generate extra income. She has a display case located in her home so that she can always be there for her children. She takes them to school, picks them up, and can sell products during the afternoon and evenings. 

This business has been very good for her and her living conditions have improved. She is very humble and always takes advice and suggestions very well. Now that she has experience, she would like to invest in her business so that it will be more lucrative, following her dreams of opening her own store.

Yuri requests a loan to purchase t-shirts, jeans, deodorants, hand cream and accessories (buckles, phone cases, nail polish, hair accessories, etc.). This loan will allow her to have more merchandise and add new things to her display case.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, jeans, deodorant, hand cream, and accessories (buckles, phone cases, nail polish, hair accessories, etc.).

loans.name: Visita Isabel

texts.es:
Visita es una mujer de 31 años de edad, ella vive junto con su pareja y sus 5 hijos de 18, 17, 14, 16, 12 años de edad, siempre se dedicó a realizar las labores de ama de casa, atendiendo a su marido y esposo, sirviéndole su comida, realizando labores de casa, una madre típica, su esposo es un hombre que trabaja y devenga un salario mínimo y al ser su familia tan numerosa vieron que tenían varias falencias financieras que suplían, comprando cosas de menor precio y por ende menor calidad, comiendo regular, limitándose mucho, cansada de esta situación la señora Visita decidió buscar como emplearse en un negocio y fue en el año 2012 cuando un amigo le recomendé que aprovechara sus habilidades culinarias e iniciara a vender alimentos y desde entonces esto se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos.

Desde que Visita se encuentra trabajando las condiciones en su hogar han cambiado drásticamente para bien, comen bien, sus hijos estudian, tienen uniformes y útiles escolares y ella sigue buscando como mejorar, seguir apoyando el estudio de sus muchachos y reformar su hogar.

Visita quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos para elaborar sus alimentos, como lo son salsas, carnes, arroz, panela, endulzantes, vegetales, frutas porque acompaña sus alimentos con jugos naturales, entre otros.
texts.en:
Visita is a 31 year old woman. She lives with her partner and their children, who are 18, 17, 14, 16, and 12 years old. She has always worked in the home, tending to her husband and children, preparing food, and doing housework - being a typical mother. Her husband is the one who works and receives a minimum wage salary. 

Because their family is so large, they found that they were lacking money, even while purchasing things at a low price and low quality, eating normally, and limiting themselves a lot. Visita was tired of the situation and decided to find a business where she could work. In 2012, a friend recommended that she take advantage of her culinary skills and sell food. Since then, this has become her main source of income.

Since Visita began to work, their household conditions have improved greatly. They eat will, the children study, and they have uniforms and school supplies. She continues to look for ways to improve, to continue supporting her children's educations, and to reform her household. 

Visita would like to request a loan to purchase supplies to prepare food, like sauces, meats, rice, brown sugar, sweeteners, vegetables, fruits (because she pairs her food with natural juices), and other things.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make food, like sauces, meats, rice, brown sugar, sweeteners, and vegetables.

loans.name: Mery Luz

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 28 años de edad, ella es una persona muy pujante que busca un mejor bienestar para su hija de 12 años de edad, para sus padres y para ella misma, monto a principios del presente año un negocio en la sala de su casa el cual es una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, con la idea de ayudar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar.

De momento se encuentra trabajando sola, en una jornada de lunes a viernes 12 horas por día, no cuenta con experiencia solo tiene su sonrisa y buena disposición para hacer las cosas.

Como Mery inicio con un capital tan bajo no cuenta con estanterías, vitrinas, mesas y surtir de buena manera su tienda con abarrotes y granos.

Mery busca sacar su negocio adelante ya que busca le mejor bien para su hijos por ello está muy empeñada en hacer que su negocio florezca y de momento tiene unas necesidades que necesita suplir las cuales son:
•	Comprar estanterías
•	Comprar mesas
•	Comprar surtido en arroz, panela, salsa, productos de panadería, papas en bolsa.
Este apoyo ayudara a Mery a fortalecer su negocio, afianzándolo por su sector residencial y avisándole a la competencia que viene Mery una fuerte competidora.
texts.en:
Mery is a 28 year old woman. She is s very forceful person who is looking for better well-being for her 12 year old daughter, her parents and for herself. At the beginning of this year she opened a business in a room of her house which is a store selling basic food items with the idea of helping her partner with the household expenses.

At the moment she is working alone, from Monday to Friday in a 12 hour day. She has no experience only her smile and a willing disposition to get things done. As Mery started with such little capital she does not have shelves, display cases, tables and a well stocked store with groceries and grains. Mery wants to get her business ahead as she wants the best for her children. So she is very committed to make her business flourish.

At this time she needs supplies like buying shelving, tables, an assortment of rice, raw cane sugar, sauces, bakery products and bags of chips. This support will help Mery to strengthen her business, supported by her residential area and giving notice to the competition that Mery will become a fierce competitor.

loans.use: to buy shelves, tables, an assortment of rice, whole cane sugar, sauces, bakery products and chips.

loans.name: Halombo

texts.fr:
Mme HALOMBO est mariée et mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Les  02 vont à l’école. Elle a  03personnes en charge.
Mme fabrique et vend du savon liquide depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marchés.
Elle veut s’acheter 40kg de produit pour la fabrication du savon liquide.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin de construire une maison d'habitation et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne devenir une grande productrice de savon et pouvoir approvisionner les petits villages.
texts.en:
Halombo is a married mother to two children. Her eldest is 15 years old and her youngest is 10 years old. Both of them are currently receiving an education. She has three people living under her care.

Halombo has been making and selling her home-made liquid soap for the past six years. She gets her supplies from the main markets.

She would like to purchase 40 kg of base materials for making liquid soap.

Halombo would like to use these profits to build her own home and pay for her children's school fees. It is her ambition to become a large soap manufacturer and to sell her wares to the smaller villages.

loans.use: to purchase 40 kg of base materials for making liquid soap

loans.name: Marlene De Carmen

texts.es:
Marlene, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. junto a su esposo, para realizar sus actividades diarias.

Marlene, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio lo desempeña desde hace varios años junto a su esposo, durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas, para vender la leche entre sus vecinos. 

Marlene, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca lechera, porque quiere producir más leche para vender y de esa manera incrementar sus ingresos.

Marlene, sueña con aumentar su venta de leche y sembrar más, para comprar más vacas.
texts.en:
Marlene is 38 years old and attended school until the ninth grade. She is married and her partner works in agriculture. She gets up at 4:30 am with her husband in order to complete daily tasks. Marlene works in agriculture and has done so for the past several years with her husband. She works in the fields each morning and tends to the cattle in the afternoons so that she can sell milk to her neighbors.

Marlene needs this loan to purchase a dairy cow because she would like to produce more milk to sell so that she can increase her income. Marlene dreams of increasing her milk sales business and planting more crops so that she can purchase more cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en: Nargiza is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She is living in a remote district. She is married and has three children. She has five years experience of doing business. She has her own small store where she sells food and household products. Nargiza is a kind, honest and goal oriented person. She has permanent clients every day. Her goods are finishing and she needs to buy more products from the market. She is asking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy food and household products such as napkins, nappies, drink, toys etc. Nargiza wants to earn enough money to feed her children and family as well as to spend on everyday needed clothes and food.

loans.use: to buy food and household products such as napkins, nappies, drink, toys etc.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is 49 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marlyn has requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to resell. Marlyn has been in this business for 25 years now. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to resell

loans.name: Walberto Jose

texts.es:
Walberto es un hombre de 41 años de edad que inicio un negocio en el año 2012 de cría de cerdos, su motivo para iniciar una vida como emprendedor fue el gusto que tiene por el  trabajo independiente por estar cerca de su familia y compartir con ellos, por convivir con su mascota que ama mucho.

Walberto es padre de tres hijos, dos menores de edad y uno adolescente, todos depende de ellos, su mayor orgullo es verlos que estudian, que su trabajo les permite capacitarse para aspirar a un mejor trabajo del que tiene en este momento puesto que él se dedica a las actividades de cría de ganado porcino y con esta actividad es con la que genera el sustento para su familia.

La inseguridad en su sitio de trabajo se ha convertido en un impedimento recurrente para el progreso, el robo, las cuotas que piden grupos ilegales para dejarlos trabajar tranquilos, v arias problemáticas con las que tiene que lidiar.

A pesar de estos inconvenientes Walberto sigue en pie de lucha, mejorando, sonriendo con ideas, para progresar en el momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ganado porcino.

Este préstamo representara una buena ayuda para el empresario ya que podrá mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, tener mayores existencias y todo por el préstamo.
texts.en:
Walberto is a 41-year-old man. In 2012 he started a business raising pigs. His reason for starting life as an entrepreneur was the pleasure of having independent work in order to be close to his family and share with them, and to be close to his pet that he loves very much.

Walberto is the father of three children, two younger ones and a teenager. Everything revolves around them. His greatest pride is to see them get an education, which his work permits them to do, also permitting them to aspire to better work than his at the moment.  He devotes himself to raising pigs and with this is able to support his family.

Uncertainty in his workplace has repeatedly blocked his progress. Robbery and demands by groups for illegal payment in exchange for being left alone are issues that he must struggle with.

Despite these inconveniences, Walberto carries on, improving himself, smiling, full of ideas. To get ahead he is now requesting a loan to buy pigs.

This loan will be a great help for the entrepreneur since he'll be able to improve his sales, increase his clients and have a better existence, thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 35 years old and married with two children. One of her children is already in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Marilyn has requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle. Marilyn has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a smallholder dairy farmer from Kaplemet village in the North Rift area of Kenya. He heads a family that consists of his wife, with whom he has lived with for 5 years, and a one year old child. He keeps dairy cows that provide him with his main source of income, as well as poultry and sheep too. 

The 4 acre land that Shadrack farms on is sloppy and dry. Small animals like sheep and goat do well in such contours but not cows, especially grade dairy cows. For this reason, Shadrack is seeking a KES 30,000 to construct a cowshed. The cowshed will not only protect his animals from harsh weather but also pave the way for the introduction of a zero-grazing technique where he will feed his stock in their confines. 

With this loan investment in his business, he projects that his cows will grow healthier and be more productive. This will have a positive impact on his farm business as well as family income and welfare.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Deodita

texts.en: Deodita is 54 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are in school. Deodita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Deodita has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Deodita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Jeannette vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 23 ans. Célibataire, Jeannette œuvre dynamiquement pour promouvoir son épanouissement. Jeannette vend des friperies dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour sa subsistance. Jeannette s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des chemises, Jeannette demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité.
texts.en: Jeannette lives in Adidogomé and is 23 years old. She is unmarried and works energetically to come into her own. She sells secondhand clothing in and around her district to have the income necessary to live. She supplies herself with goods twice a month at the market. To order shirts, Jeannette is asking for this loan to make her purchases and to be profitable.

loans.use: to purchase 113 shirts

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani is 35 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in Salt. She has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from her husband, who is working as guard. She is working hard towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family. Tahani is applying for a loan to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en: A $1500.00 loan is offered to Silvina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy everyday. She will buy gasoline and diesel with this loan. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels very comfortable to run her business because she can earn money everyday. Running a business has made Silvina independent because she can be responsible for herself as well as helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and diesel

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Channa is a 31-year-old married factory worker with two children in her care, who resides in the Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has worked in the factory since 2013. Her husband is a 28-year-old, and he makes drums for selling .One of her a child attends school. Channa and her husband can make around $15 per day. She has decided to take out a loan because she needs money to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy a cow. In the future, she is going to save enough money to build a proper house and to support all her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Lutfiniso

texts.en:
Lutfiniso is a bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is living in a small village with her family. She is married and has three children.

Her husband is in construction and works seasonally. She is busy in agriculture and has three livestock animals. Lutfiniso has 20 years of experience in keeping livestock. She likes to do business in agriculture and take care of livestock in order to have good customers and earn money.

She wants to renovate her house and asks for a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON. She hopes to have good conditions, better to live in, because in her current house it is hard to live. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 41 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She operates a hog-raising business to help her husband in generating income to sustain her family's daily needs and finance the education of her child. She aims to improve more of her business but she has limited capital. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy hog feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She is hoping that this financial assistance will  help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion is 54 years old, married and has four children. Salvacion is in the aquaculture business where she does oyster culturing in the Philippines. Salvacion has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to buy bamboo, binders and other materials needed for her oyster culture business. Salvacion has been doing this oyster culturing for 30 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binders and other materials needed for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Mario Desiderio

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre muy serio, riguroso, de temperamento, vive junto con su esposa y  5 hijos en el campo de las zonas de Sincelejo su actividad principal es la cría de ganado porcino, esta actividad la ha desarrollado por varios años.

Mario antes trabajaba por generar los ingresos necesarios para vivir, ya que no sabia como potenciar su negocio, desde la llegada de interactuar a esta zona de inclusión social ha cambiado la maniera de pensar de los empresarios ofreciéndoles servicios de desarrollo empresarial donde les enseñan cómo manejar su negocio y dándole el apoyo del microcrédito para inviertan en este.

Mario aprovecho esto y ahora gracias a las clases tiene una idea de cómo guiar este proyecto para generar mayor rentabilidad buscando mejorar sus condiciones de vida y salir de la pobreza.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, construcción de cocheras, adecuación de cocheras, compra de cuido, será su paso inicial hacia la consolidación de su negocio y solo espera que lo ayudes para progresar y sacar su numerosa familia adelante.
texts.en:
Mario is a very serious, rigorous man. He lives with his wife and 5 children in the countryside in the area of Sincelejo. His primary activity is raising pigs, which he has been developing for several years.

Before, Mario worked to generate an income to live, since he did not know how to strengthen his business. Since Kiva partner "Interactuar" arrived in this social inclusion zone, it has changed the way that business owners think, offering them services for business development where they are taught how to manage their business and giving them the support of micro loans to invest in their businesses.

Mario took advantage of this and now thanks to the classes he has an idea of how to guide this project to generate better profits, looking to improve his living conditions and getting out of poverty.

Mario wants to request this loan in order to purchase pigs, construct a shed, adapt sheds and buy necessary care for the pigs. This will be his first step towards the consolidation of his business and he just hopes that you can help him progress and help his large family get ahead.

loans.use: buy pigs, build sheds, adapt sheds and buy necessary care for the pigs.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 43 ans, Akoko est une femme avec cinq enfants à sa charge. Akoko habite à Adidogomé et prépare de la bouillie à base du maïs qu’elle vend dans son quartier gagner son revenu et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Akoko réalise son bénéfice et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, Akoko demande ce prêt pour réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire et promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akoko, married and 43 years old, is a woman with five children to support. She lives in Adidogomé and makes cornmeal porridge, which she sells in her neighborhood to earn an income and to meet the needs of the family. Akoko makes a profit and gets her supplies twice a month at the market. To order sacks of corn, Akoko is asking for this loan to make a good profit margin and to advance her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Eya est une femme veuve qui est âgée de 39 ans. Mère de quatre enfants, Eya habite à Agoè pour exercer ses activités. Eya est très dynamique et pour aider sa famille, elle vend des sacs de friperies en parcourant son quartier afin de trouver son bénéfice. Eya s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de friperies, Eya sollicite ce prêt pour financer son achat et trouver assez de profits et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants et permettre leur éducation.
texts.en: Eya is a widow who is 39 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in Agoè to operate her business. She is very energetic, and to help her family she sells bags of secondhand clothing door to door, so as to make a profit. She gets her supplies five times a month at the market. To order bags of used clothing, Eya is requesting this loan to finance her purchase and to make enough profit to help out her children and allow for their education.

loans.use: to purchase a few bags of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Obubé

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 33 ans, Obubé est mère d’un seul enfant. Obubé habite dans de Kégué pour exercer ses activités. Obubé vend des friperies dans le quartier afin de trouver son bénéfice et satisfaire agréablement ses besoins quotidiens. Obubé s’approvisionne trois fois au marché pour disposer de son stock. Dans le souci de commander des slips, Obubé demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer une marge bénéficiaire pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Obubé, aged 33, is a married mother of one child and lives in Kégué to operate her business. She sells secondhand clothing in her district to make a profit and to meet her day-to-day needs. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market for her stock of goods. Concerned about ordering some undergarments, Obubé is asking for this loan to realize her purchases and to make a profit margin for helping her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 7 dozen undergarments

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 31 years old and she is married with one child. She lives in Aqaba. Dina is a conservative woman and has asked her husband to take her place in the photo. She works in commerce. She has been involved in this business for more than two years now. Dina sells accessories, cosmetics, clothes and party supplies. She also rents wedding dresses.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Dina is not having enough money to buy products. She is requesting a loan to purchase new products to sell and expand her work that will increase her income. She will be able to help her husband more and more. In the future, Dina hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase new products to sell and expand her work that will increase her incomes

loans.name: Sabah's Group

texts.en:
Sabah and Khawla are married women and caring mothers. They work hard to provide for their family. For the past two years, Sabah has started to sell cosmetics products in her home. Her friend Khawla decided to work with Sabah in her business and help her husband. They have will power that will give them the ability to be productive women in the future.

Sabah and Khawla have requested a loan to purchase additional products to sell and expand their work to increase their incomes and improve the standard of living for their families.

They aspire to save enough to provide a secure future for their families, so they need your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics to sell.
